member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.IPathDrawer.DrawCharPath(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape2D,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Drawing.ArgbColor,System.Int16,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Draw a path for a character.
member.param: path to draw. Is assumed to be the same shape instance for the same character of a font so based on this it can be used as a key for e.g. a cache lookup.
either 0 or the extrusion in z direction before transformation

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.IPathDrawer.IsSeparateCharDrawingPreferred
member.summary: Is this drawer gaining from drawing separate chars rather than drawing complete strings?
member.remarks: Usually a complete string is draw as one path. Splitting this into single paths for each letter is an order N algorithm (N being the number of letters), so if the drawer works with less effiency depending on the number of paths/points involved (N log N or worse) it should return true here. But be sure to test both cases with a TTF text intensive file because sometimes the memory overhead of creating all new paths eat up the gain.
member.returns: true if this drawer gains from small filled paths, false otherwise

member.name: F:WW.Cad.IO.ImageExporter.Margin
member.summary: Margin in pixels around images created from models.
member.remarks: Without this margin Windows will not render the graphics on the outer edges. Also there seems to be always an empty unused line around the bitmap. Not a real problem, just a minor waste of space.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.ImageExporter.CreateAutoSizedBitmap(WW.Cad.Drawing.GDI.GDIGraphics3D,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.SmoothingMode,WW.Math.Matrix4D)
member.summary: Create a bitmap from the specified CAD graphics. The size is calculated automatically based on the drawing.

remarks.para: The bitmap created will be as big as the 2d bounds of the given CAD graphics plus a 2 pixel margin on every side.
If the drawing is empty, then a 1 by 1 pixel empty bitmap is returned.

member.param: The smoothing mode used for drawing.
The to 2d transformation. Note that any translation will be lost.

member.summary: Create a bitmap from the specified model. The size is calculated automatically based on the drawing.
member.remarks: If the drawing is empty, then an empty bitmap is returned with the specified maxSize.
member.param: The CAD graphics object to use for drawing.
The smoothing mode used for drawing.
The transform to apply to the drawing. Note that any scaling/translation will be lost.
Maximum bitmap size. A total transformation will be calculated such that the drawing will fit the bitmap. Thus any original scaling and translation in the original transform will be lost.

member.remarks: SHX files in bigfont format come in different encodings, but the encoding is not defined in the file. These method gives a workaround allowing to define the encoding of a given file.
member.param: Bigfont filename. It will be reduced to its basic part, so there is no need to give a complete path.
Encoding of the font contained in the given file

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ShxFile.AddOldShxEncoding(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Add an encoding to the encoding mapping for old SHX files.
member.remarks: Modern SHX files are encoded in Unicode format. But SHX files in the 1.0 and 1.1 format have an unknown internal encoding. This allows to set the encoding for a given SHX file. If no encoding for an old file is defined, the file is assumed to be in encoding. Setting the encoding here will only have an effect for SHX files in old 1.0 or 1.1 formats, newer SHX files in Unicode format with the same name will not be affected.
member.param: SHX filename. It will be reduced to its basic part, so there is no need to give a complete path.
encoding of the font contained in the given file

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ShxFile.GetBigFontEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Get the encoding of a bigfont file.
member.returns: encoding or null if the encoding is unknown

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ShxFile.GetOldShxEncoding(System.String,WW.Cad.Model.DrawingCodePage)
member.summary: Get the encoding of an old SHX file.
member.param: Codepage used if no special encoding is defined.
member.returns: encoding, or default if no special encoding is known.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity
member.summary: Base class for AutoCAD entities (graphical objects like lines, circles etc).

remarks.para: The main properties of an entity are , , , and .

An entity is either in model space or in paper space (see property ). By default an entity is in model space. A model space entity must be part of DxfModel.Entities, a paper space entity must be part of DxfLayout.Entities of the paper space layout on which the entity is shown. The exception to this rule is when the entity is part of a , which can be shown on either model or paper space, depending on if the referencing is in model or paper space. When showing model space (see DxfHeader.ShowModelSpace), entities in paper space are invisible. When showing paper space, entities in model space are first transformed to paper space as specified by a view port. Entities in paper space are not transformed.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHandledObject.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone of the same source object a new CloneContext instance has to be used. For cloning multiple objects once only one CloneContext is needed (as demonstrated in the example below).
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHandledObject.Compose(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel)
member.summary: This method is called after reading the raw objects from file. Some files with a certain version contain additional information from later versions, so older AutoCAD files can still read the simpler objects, but later AutoCAD files can "recompose" the original full objects from the simpler objects + recompose data. The recompose data is usually present in the form of xrecords in the extension dictionary of an object.

Overriding methods must add the action to the undoStack only if it succeeded. If it succeeded partially (in case of child actions), the undoStack should contain the successful child actions that succeeded, so they can be rolled back.

member.param: Stack for adding an undo operation for the changes done by the transforamtion.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity.LineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the line weight (default value is ).

remarks.para: A line weight in model space translates to a width in pixels, regardless of zoom level. In paper space the line weight translates to the exact physical width in mm.
This property was introduced in

item.description: Standard
By layer
By block
an integer representing 100th of mm, must be one of the following values: 0, 5, 9, 13, 15, 18, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 50, 53, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100, 106, 120, 140, 158, 200, 211.

remarks.para: For model space the whether line weight is displayed is controlled by property .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity.PaperSpace
member.summary: Gets whether the entity is in paper space. if in model space.

remarks.para: Default is . CadLib sets this value depending on if the entity is added to a model or paper space
When showing model space (see also ), entities in paper space are invisible.
When showing paper space, entities in model space are first transformed to paper space as specified by a view port. Entities in paper space are not transformed.
When an entity is part of a then this should always be false. Whether the entity is in paper space depends then on whether the referencing the block is in paper space (see also ).

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity.DefaultCreateInteractor
member.summary: A default interactor for creating an entity based on its control points.
member.remarks: Control points are created or set until all entity's control points are defined. At that point the is committed. When the user cancels the entity creation, the transaction is rolled back. The can be used to undo/redo the setting of individual control points, but once the transaction is committed, these individual commands are no longer of interest, and just one command can go unto the undo stack for adding the completed entity.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.ReferenceResolutionType
member.summary: How to handle missing referenced objects when cloning objects from one to another.
member.remarks:
E.g. a entity references a with name "X" that is not yet present in the target model where the entity is cloned to. In that case three options are available to resolve this:
Ignore the missing reference and use the default of the target model.
Clone the referenced objects, too.
Throw an exception when a reference is missing.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.ReferenceResolutionType.IgnoreMissing
member.summary: Ignore missing reference.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.ReferenceResolutionType.CloneMissing
member.summary: Clone missing reference.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.ReferenceResolutionType.FailOnMissing
member.summary: Throw an exception when a reference is missing.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfObject
member.summary: Base object for objects in the DXF OBJECTS section. An object have no graphical or geometrical meaning.
member.remarks: Objects are similar to entities, except that they have no graphical or geometric meaning. All objects that are not entities (namespace or symbol table records or symbol tables (namespace ) are stored in this section.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Text.AbstractBasicTextMetrics
member.summary: Base class for text metrics, containing basic settings. It takes care of transforming the results to match a certain .
member.remarks: Extending classes only need to define the metrics for canonical texts, i.e. texts with an ascent size of 1 and no specialities like slant or aspect ratio. But they still have to take care of the char spacing factor ( when calculating their metrics.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter
member.summary: This class will draw a CAD drawing onto a PDF document.

remarks.para: Add pages to the PDF document by calling one of the DrawPage overloads and call to close the document.
Note that the PDF x-axis points right and the y-axis points up, and the origin is at the bottom left.

The PDF exporter supports retaining text entities as text in PDF so the PDF can be searched for text and the text can be copied to the clipboard from the PDF file. To retain the text, set property GraphicsConfig.TryDrawingTextAsText to true. For some fonts and unicode characters this will not work properly, therefore the PDF exporter also supports font embedding. To enable font embedding set property to true (GraphicsConfig.TryDrawingTextAsText must be true as well). Font embedding does make the PDF file larger.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.DrawPage(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,System.Double,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport},System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize)
member.summary: Draw given model on a new PDF page using given layout and view ports.
member.param: The configuration that steers the drawing.
Transform from paper space to pdf paper space.
The paper space to PDF scale factor (used to determine the line width based on each entity's line weight). Use e.g. to calculate a scaling transform and scale factor.
The view ports to use for rendering (optional).
The paper size (see also and to get a paper size from a paper kind.)
member.remarks: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically close the stream after writing (the default value is true).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.Author
member.summary: Gets or sets the author.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the line width. The default value is 0.1.

remarks.para: Quote from the PDF spec: It is a nonnegative number expressed in user space units. A line width of 0 denotes the thinnest line that can be rendered at device resolution: 1 device pixel wide.

This value is only used if GraphicsConfig.DisplayLineWeight is set to false. Otherwise the normal line weight of the entity is used multiplied by . To choose a proper value, take into account that the size of a PDF pixel is 1 / 72th of an inch.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.TextLineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the line width for text entities. The default value is 0.1.

remarks.para: This value is only used if GraphicsConfig.DisplayLineWeight is set to false. Otherwise the normal line weight of the entity is used multiplied by . To choose a proper value, take into account that the size of a PDF pixel is 1 / 72th of an inch.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.Document
member.summary: Gets the PDF document.
member.remarks: The document can be used to add further pages to the document, not using this exporter object. Pages have to be added to the object.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.Body
member.summary: Gets the PDF body.
member.remarks: The document can be used to add further pages to the document, not using this exporter object. A PDF document can have 1 or more bodies. A single body represents a document revision. Since this exporter creates a new PDF document, there is just one body object.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.ModelSpaceLineWeightToPdfPixels
member.summary: Gets or sets the factor that is used to convert line weight to PDF pixels (used for model space only, not for paper space layouts).
member.remarks: The default value is 0.001 * , so line weight is translated to have the correct line width expressed in PDF pixels. Note that in model space the line weight is applied irrespective of the zoom factor or drawing units.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.UseMultipleLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use multiple layers. The default value is false.

remarks.para: By default the elements are just drawn in the order in which they appear in the drawing.
When set to true the PDF exporter puts filled elements on the bottom layer, on top of this the stroked elements are put, and on the very top all text is drawn.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.ExportLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to export ACAD layers. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Layers will be exported as PDF optional content groups and will be grouped by pages.
The layer order may be changed by setting the . The default value is null, meaning that the layer order of the drawing is used.

The PDF layer's enabled (on/off) state is determined by the layer's and property by default, but this behavior can be overridden by . Entities are included in the exported PDF based on whether the layer's enabled/frozen state, but the behavior can be adjusted with properties and .
Each page label will be formatted by .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.PageFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the page format string used when is true. The default value is "Page {0}".
member.remarks: This property can be used to provide translations to other languages.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.LayerComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer comparer used for defining the layer order in the layer navigation window when is true. The default value is null, meaning that the layer order of the drawing is used.
member.remarks: Use e.g. .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.IsPdfLayerEnabledFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the function to determine whether the PDF layer is enabled based on the CAD layer passed to the function. This function is called when is true. The default value is null.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to embed TrueType fonts in the PDF file. The default value is false. Set property GraphicsConfig.TryDrawingTextAsText to true for this property to take effect.

remarks.para: Please take care that embedding a font is only allowed if you have the proper license to embed the font.
This will only have an effect if text entities are converted as text.
PDF is notoriously bad displaying certain Unicode characters by default, so in order for them to appear correctly you may need to set this to true.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.PackContent
member.summary: Compress the content of the PDF?
member.remarks: This should be true (the default) usually to keep the resulting PDF small.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfExporter.ExportLayerHelper
member.summary: Get the layer helper if there is one.

member.summary: Tricky method to create an entity from a dedicated group reader.
member.remarks: Currently used to create MTEXT from an XRECORD as happens in ATTRIB/ATTDEF. This method has to stay internally as the current implementation does not handle resolving of references, which has to be done elsewhere.

member.returns: The entity or null when something goes wrong.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.DxfReader.GetObjectWithHandle``1(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Get an object with a given handle as a defined type.
member.remarks: This method will add warnings if the given handle is undefined or the found object is of wrong type.
member.returns: An object of the given type or null if there is no object with the given handle or the object is of a different type.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.DxfReader.ReadEntities
member.summary: Read entities section.
member.remarks: Precondition: position must be at start of section.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.DxfReader.ReadEntities(System.Collections.Generic.IList{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity},WW.Cad.IO.Group)
member.summary: Read entities until given end marker is read.

remarks.para: Precondition: position must be at start of first entity.

Model space entities are added to specified entities collection. Paper space entities are added to collection paperSpaceEntities which will be assigned to layouts during reference resolution. Similarly viewports are added to collection viewports.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.DxfReader.LoadUnknownObjects
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load unknown objects. The default value is false. Unknown entities might contain proxy graphics that can be displayed by CadLib. Proxy graphics contain the graphical representation of the object that is not directly supported by the DWG and DXF format.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.DxfReader.ThrowExceptionOnInvalidGroupCode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to throw an exception when encountering an invalid group codes. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Some older CadLib versions wrote invalid group codes under rare circumstances. By default CadLib does not read these invalid group codes, but by setting this property to false it will accept these group codes.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants
member.summary: Static class used to hold various constants.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.NonPeriodicLength
member.summary: Return value used for non-periodic intervals.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EorMarker
member.summary: The end-of-record marker.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EofMarker
member.summary: Special EOF marker in SAT file.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EofAsmMarker
member.summary: Special EOF marker in SAT file.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.NullIndex
member.summary: Index for null pointer.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EorMarkerString
member.summary: The end-of-record marker as a string.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ParamVersion
member.summary: The version at which the start parameter and end parameter values of edges were removed from the save file, and recomputed if required.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LumpVersion
member.summary: The version at which LUMPs were introduced, to subdivide bodies into disjoined connected regions.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.CurveVersion
member.summary: The version at which curve types were first output to the save file as character strings instead of integers.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.SurfaceVersion
member.summary: The version at which surface types were first output to the save file as character strings instead of integers.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.IntcurveVersion
member.summary: The version at which subtypes of intcurves were defined requiring classification in the save file.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.SplineVersion
member.summary: The version at which subtypes of splines were defined requiring classification in the save file.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.DollarVersion
member.summary: The version at which pointers were first distinguished from integers in text files by a dollar sign.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.SharableVersion
member.summary: The version at which sharable objects like int_cur and spl_sur were first surrounded by curly braces, and could be shared in the save file.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.BlendVersion
member.summary: The version at which blend attributes lost their ?form? integer value (which was always zero, and so redundant).

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ParcurVersion
member.summary: The version at which parameter curves may have the defining parameter curve and surface in either slot 1 or 2.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.PcurveVersion
member.summary: The version at which pcurves may have different subtypes, and so need a type code.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TwosideVersion
member.summary: The version at which faces may be double?sided, either free sheets or embedded in material.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LogioVersion
member.summary: The version at which logical values are written to the save file as 'T' or 'F' instead of as integers.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.SortcoedVersion
member.summary: The version at which coedges were first expected to be sorted clockwise around the edge.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.InfintVersion
member.summary: The version at which intervals could be (semi?)infinite, and so require different save file format.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.BndcurVersion
member.summary: The version at which curves have a subset range to bound them within their natural range.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.BndsurVersion
member.summary: The version at which surfaces have a subset range to bound them within their natural range.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.MultsavVersion
member.summary: The version at which multiple entities can be saved into a single save file unit (as opposed to multiple self?contained sections of a file).

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.FileinterfaceVersion
member.summary: The version in which save and restore started using a FileInterface object to do the io.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.WireboolVersion
member.summary: The version in which ?Wire Booleans? were implemented, requiring extensions to the data structure.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ThreedeyeRefVersion
member.summary: The version in which ?3D eye refinements? were implemented.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.HistoryVersion
member.summary: Version in which the History Manager was introduced

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.SaferangeVersion
member.summary: The version in which ?Safe Ranges? for intcurves were implemented, requiring an extra field in the data structure.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.AngXcurVersion
member.summary: The version which introduced angled cross curves at the ends of face?face blends, requiring extra fields in ATTRIB_FFBLEND.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.AdvBlVersion
member.summary: The version at which advanced blending facilities were first made available.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EnumAsStringVersion
member.summary: The version where the enum values were started being saved as string.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ConsistentVersion
member.summary: The version where the save/restore of logicals, enums was made consistent

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.FileinfoVersion
member.summary: The version where the additional header information was added

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.MeshVersion
member.summary: The version where the mesh classes were added

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ExtCuSfVersion
member.summary: The version where extended curves and surfaces were introduced.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.CoedgeSenseVersion
member.summary: The version where coedges were given sense enumeration strings.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ArcwiseSkinVersion
member.summary: The version at which Skin/Loft surfaces have a subset range to bound them within their natural range.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.AdvVarBlendTwoRadiiVersion
member.summary: The version in which adv_var_blend attributes output a logical specifying if two radii functions are used

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LawVersion
member.summary: The version in which laws first where added to ACIS

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.OffsetRevVersion
member.summary: The version in which reflection of offset_spl_surs was handled

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.DiscontinuityVersion
member.summary: The version in which discontinuity information was stored in int_curs and spl_surs

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TaperExistenceVersion
member.summary: The version in which taper_spl_surs came into existence

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TaperVersion
member.summary: The version in which taper_spl_surs were split into derived classes

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.NetSplVersion
member.summary: The version in which net surface was added to ACIS

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LawSplVersion
member.summary: The version in which law curves and surfaces where added to ACIS

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ConeScalingVersion
member.summary: The version at which cones have a new member, representing the scaling factor of the u parameter.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LoftLawVersion
member.summary: The version in which laws in lofts where added to ACIS

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.RefMinUvGridVersion
member.summary: The version in which refinement ?min_u_grid_lines and min_v_grid_lines? were added.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.VblendAutoVersion
member.summary: The version at which vertex blend attributes were given a new member describing the method of auto setback calculation, if any.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.BlEnvSfVersion
member.summary: The version at which the true rolling?ball envelope surface was introduced for var_blend_spl_sur?s.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.EllipseOffsetVersion
member.summary: The version in which ellipse offset with an ellipse base curve so that they will extend the ellipse and not linearly.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TolModelingVersion
member.summary: The version at which Tolerant Modeling was introduced.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.ApproxSummaryVersion
member.summary: The version in which approximating geometry could be stored in summary form.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TaperScalingVersion
member.summary: The version at which a scaling factor was saved for tapers.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.LazyBSplineVersion
member.summary: The version at which lazy b-splines were introduced.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.DmMultiSurfVersion
member.summary: The version at which multi?surfaces were introduced to Deformable Modelling

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.DmMultiSurfColorVersion
member.summary: The version at which link constraint color persistence was introduced to Deformable Modelling

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.RecalSkinErrorVersion

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.SatConstants.TaperURuledVersion

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.ISatEntityResolver
member.summary: Handler for entity resolve.
member.remarks: Entities in SAT refer to other entities by an index. The resolver allows to access the entities per index, and to register a handler to bind entities which are not yet read.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.ISatEntityResolver.RegisterEntityBinder(System.Int32,WW.Cad.Model.Acis.BindEntity)
member.summary: Register an entity binder.
member.remarks: The binder is never called if the index is less than 0, it is called immediately if the index can be resolved to an entity, and it may be called later as soon as an entity with the given index is registered.
member.param: index for which binder is called
binder to be called for the given index

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Acis.ISatEntityResolver.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get an entity for a given index.
member.returns: entity or null if the index is less than 0 or the entity index cannot (yet) be resolved

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.DwgWriter

member.summary: Writes the specified model to a file with specified file name.

member.summary: Writes the specified model to the specified stream.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.DwgWriter.Write
member.summary: Write the model.

remarks.para: Before writing is called to check if the model is valid. When it is not valid a is thrown with a list of messages.
After writing the underlying stream is closed if is true.

member.exception: Thrown when model is invalid.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.DwgWriter.Write(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write the model.

remarks.para: Before writing optionally is called to check if the model is valid. When it is not valid a is thrown with a list of messages.
After writing the underlying stream is closed if is true.

member.param: Specifies whether is called before writing.
member.exception: Thrown when model is invalid.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.DwgWriter.AutoCloseStream
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically close the stream after writing (the default value is true).

member.summary: Creates exploded dimensions; there is no association between elements of the dimension, and the lines, arcs, arrowheads, and text of a dimension are drawn as separate objects.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.DimensionAssociativity.NonAssociative
member.summary: Creates non-associative dimension objects; the elements of the dimension are formed into a single object, and if the definition point on the object moves, then the dimension value is updated.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Model.DimensionAssociativity.Associative
member.summary: Creates associative dimension objects; the elements of the dimension are formed into a single object and one or more definition points of the dimension are coupled with association points on geometric objects.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.XamlExporter
member.summary: Represents a class for exporting a CAD drawing to the XAML format (Extensible Application Markup Language; pronounced "zammel").

remarks.para: Because a XAML file cannot contain embedded images this exporter silently discards all images contained in the model.
For display of lines on screen, it is important to set a proper value so a fitting pen stroke thickness can be calculated.

member.summary: Draw given model on the XAML stream.
member.remarks: Draws only the model space entities.
member.param: The configuration that steers the drawing.
Transform from model space to XAML paper space.

member.remarks: Draws only the model space entities.

Pass handler to track the progress. May be null.

member.summary: Draw given model on the XAML stream using given view port.

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

The configuration that steers the drawing.
Transform from paper space to XAML paper space.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.PatternWriter
member.summary: Writer for objects to pattern files with extension .pat.

remarks.para: Custom pattern files have the same file name as the pattern name, but with the .pat extension.
Note that no pattern files are supplied with CadLib, but free .pat files are present on the internet. AutoCAD stores its predefined patterns in Acad.pat.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.PatternWriter.WritePatterns(System.String,WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfPattern[])
member.summary: Writes given objects to file with given filename.
member.remarks: The filename should be the same as the pattern name when the file represents a single custom pattern. The filename should end in .pat. If it doesn't ".pat" is appended.
member.param: The filename of the file to write the patterns to.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfProxyEntity
member.summary: Represents a proxy entity containing graphics data for custom objects. This allows systems that do not support these custom objects to display their graphical data.

remarks.para: At the moment this entity only supported for and later.
Note that proxy graphics may also be part of . By default unknown entities are not read from DWG/DXF files. To read them pass true for the loadUnknownObjects in the method.

member.summary: Gets whether merging or splitting of the DXF data in the custom object data streams is needed. After R18 strings are stored in a separate string data stream. And therefore data from before R18 needs to be split. The other way around holds as well, split streams may need to be merged when writing to R18 and earlier.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.ModelBuilder.GetObjectWithHandle(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Get an object with a given handle.

member.returns: Object with the given handle or null if there is no such object.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.ModelBuilder.GetObjectWithHandle``1(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Get an object with a given handle as a defined type.
member.remarks: This method will add warnings if the given handle is undefined or the found object is of wrong type.
member.returns: An object of the given type or null if there is no object with the given handle or the object is of a different type.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3DUsingDrawingVisual.CreateDrawingVisuals(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout)
member.summary: Creates framework elements for given DXF model using specified layout (see property ).

remarks.para: The old framework elements are cleared before creating the new ones.

The entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the view ports in specified layout. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3DUsingDrawingVisual.CreateDrawingVisuals(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport})
member.summary: Creates framework elements for given DXF model using given view port (see property ).

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.summary: Creates framework elements for given dxf model using given view port (see property ).

remarks.para: The entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The model of which the entities are part.
The entities in model space to draw.
The entities in model space to draw.
The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.summary: Quick check a given volume for its clipping.
member.remarks: This method may not be exact, but provides a good means for optimization.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.IClippingTransformer.IsInside(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape4D)
member.summary: Check a shape how it is clipped.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless and it is much better to use the method directly. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.
member.param: Shape to check for clipping, possibly changed during the check.

member.summary: Transforms and clips a generic shape.

member.returns: Transformed and possibly clipped result shape.

member.summary: Multiplies transformation with given transform (pre).

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.BasicTransformer.TryIsInside(WW.Math.Bounds3D)
member.summary: Check a given volume for its clipping.
member.remarks: This method may not be exact, but provides a good means for optimization.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.BasicTransformer.IsInside(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape4D)
member.summary: Check a shape how it is clipped.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless and it is much better to use the method directly. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Actions.SelectInteractor
member.summary: Represents an interactor to select one or more entities. Use the sub classes to scale and move the selection.

remarks.para: Property must be set and updated every time the projection transform for displaying the drawing changes.
In model space this interactor operates on model space entities only. In paper space this interactor operates on paper space entities only.
Attributes are treated as part of inserts based on property .

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle
member.summary: Represents the style of dimension lines, arrows, text and units.

remarks.para: The dimension style determines how entities , and are visualized.

To use feet and inches as linear units, set property to either Architectural (feet and decimal inches) or Engineering (feet and fractional inches). In both cases drawing units are interpreted as inches.

Dimension styles are an ever evolving feature which get additional properties with nearly each release of the formats. This means that not all features are supported in all versions. Refer to the documentation of each property to see if it is supported for your required save version or not.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle
member.summary: Represents a dimension style.
member.remarks: Dimension styles are an ever evolving feature which get additional properties with nearly each release of the formats. This means that not all features are supported in all versions. Refer to the documentation of each property to see if it is supported for your required save version or not.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateDimensioningSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate dimensioning suffix (corresponds to the DIMAPOST system variable). To define a pre-fix, use the "[]" string as a place holder for the measurement. For example value "mm" would be shown as a postfix, "A[]B" would show A as prefix and B as postfix.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate unit decimal places (corresponds to the DIMALTD system variable).

remarks.para: Default is 2.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitDimensioning
member.summary: Gets or sets the use of an alternate unit dimensioning (corresponds to the DIMALT system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the units format for alternate units of all dimension style families except angular (corresponds to the DIMALTU system variable).

remarks.para: Default is Decimal.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate unit scale factor. (Default is 1) (corresponds to the DIMALTF system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitToleranceDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places for tolerance values of an alternative units dimension (corresponds to the DIMALTTD system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the supression of zeros for alternate tolerance values (corresponds to the DIMALTTZ system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitZeroHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the supression of zeros for alternate unit dimension values (corresponds to the DIMALTZ system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AlternateUnitRounding
member.summary: Gets or sets the rounding of alternate units (corresponds to the DIMALTRND system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AngularDimensionDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of precision digits in angular dimensions (corresponds to the DIMADEC system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AngularUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular unit (corresponds to the DIMAUNIT system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.AngularZeroHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the controls supression of zeros for angular dimensions (corresponds to the DIMAZIN system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ArrowBlock
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrow block (the block name corresponds to the DIMBLK system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ArrowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrow size (corresponds to the DIMASZ system variable).

remarks.para: If is non zero, then diagonal tick marks are drawn in stead of an arrows at the ends of a dimension line.
Default size is 0.18.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ArrowsTextFit
member.summary: Gets or sets the fit type for dimension arrows and text if they don't fit between the extension lines (corresponds to DIMATFIT system variable). The default value is MoveBoth.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.CenterMarkSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the center mark size (corresponds to the DIMCEN system variable). The default value is 0.09.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.CursorUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor functionality for user positioned text (corresponds to the DIMUPT system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places for the tolerance values of primary units dimensions (corresponds to the DIMDEC system variable).

remarks.para: The default value is 4.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the single character decimal separator used when creating dimensions whose unit format is decimal (corresponds to the DIMDSEP system variable).

remarks.para: Default is a dot.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ExtensionLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the extension line color (default is ) (corresponds to the DIMCLRE system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ExtensionLineExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets the extension line extension (corresponds to the DIMEXE system variable).

remarks.para: Default is 0.18.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ExtensionLineOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the extension line offset (corresponds to the DIMEXO system variable).

remarks.para: Default is 0.0625.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ExtensionLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the extension line weight in 100ths of millimeters (corresponds to the DIMLWE system variable). The default value is .

remarks.para: See also for values smaller than zero. For non-negative values this is the line weight in 100ths of millimeters.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the first arrow block (the block name corresponds to the DIMBLK1 system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to generate dimension tolerances (corresponds to the DIMTOL system variable).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.LeaderArrowBlock
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader arrow block (the block name corresponds to the DIMLDRBLK system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.LimitsGeneration
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension limits generation flag (corresponds to the DIMLIM system variable).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.LinearScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear measurements scale factor (corresponds to the DIMLFAC system variable). The default value is 1.

remarks.para: If the scale factor is negative, then the (positive) scale factor is only applied to paper space dimensions.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.LinearUnitFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for all dimension types except angular (corresponds to the DIMLUNIT system variable). Default value is LinearUnitFormat.Decimal.

remarks.para: To use feet (and/or inches) as linear units, set property to either Architectural (feet and inches) or Engineering (feet and fractional feet).

For architectural and fractional formats the property determines between horizontal, diagonal or no stacking of the numerator and denominator. For alternate dimension units this property does not exist and is covered by property .
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.FractionFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction format (corresponds to the DIMFRAC system variable). The default value is .

remarks.para: This value is relevant when the linear unit format is set to architectural or fractional.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DimensionLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line color (corresponds to the DIMCLRD system variable). The default value is .
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DimensionLineExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line extension (corresponds to the DIMDLE system variable).

remarks.para: This value is only relevant when there are tick marks in stead of arrows at the ends of a dimension line (see ).
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DimensionLineGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line gap (corresponds to the DIMGAP system variable).

remarks.para: This is the distance between the dimension text and dimension line when the text cuts the dimension line in two. A value smaller than zero only affects the horizontal distance. A value greather than zero affects both the horizontal and vertical distance.
Default is 0.09.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DimensionLineIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line increment (corresponds to the DIMDLI system variable).

remarks.para: Default value is 0.38.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.DimensionLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line weight in 100ths of millimeters (corresponds to the DIMLWD system variable). The default value is .

remarks.para: See also for values smaller than zero. For non-negative values this is the line weight in 100ths of millimeters.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.MinusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minus tolerance (corresponds to the DIMTM system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.PlusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the plus tolerance (corresponds to the DIMTP system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.PostFix
member.summary: Gets or sets the general dimension postfix (corresponds to the DIMPOST system variable). To define a pre-fix, use the "<>" string as a place holder for the measurement. For example value "mm" would be shown as a postfix, "A<>B" would show A as prefix and B as postfix. When the postfix ends with the string "\X", the alternate dimension units are shown on the next line rather than on the same line as the primary dimension units.

remarks.para: Property is the counterpart for alternate dimension units.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.Rounding
member.summary: Gets or sets the rounding value for dimension distances (corresponds to the DIMRND system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall dimension scale factor (corresponds to the DIMSCALE system variable). The default is 1.

remarks.para: The following properties are scaled by the scale factor: , , , , , , , .
Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text outside horizontal flag (corresponds to the DIMTOH system variable).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.TextStyle
member.summary: The text style. By default it is set to the "STANDARD" text style (corresponds to the DIMTXSTY system variable).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.TextVerticalPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the text vertical position (corresponds to the DIMTVP system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.TickSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the tick size (corresponds to the DIMTSZ system variable).

remarks.para: The tick size defines the distance the tick extends beyond the extension lines, parallel to the dimension line.
If non zero, then diagonal tick marks are drawn at the ends of the dimension line. Otherwise arrows of size are drawn.
The default size is 0.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ToleranceAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical justification for tolerance values (corresponds to the DIMTOLJ system variable).

remarks.para: Default is Middle.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ToleranceDecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the tolerance decimal places (corresponds to the DIMTDEC system variable).

remarks.para: The default value is 4.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.IDimensionStyle.ToleranceScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale factor used to calculate the height for dimension fractions and tolerances (corresponds to the DIMTFAC system variable). The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.LinearScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear measurements scale factor (corresponds to the DIMLFAC system variable). The default value is 1.

remarks.para: If the scale factor is negative, then the (positive) scale factor is only applied to paper space dimensions.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.LinearUnitFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for all dimension types except angular (corresponds to the DIMLUNIT system variable). Default value is LinearUnitFormat.Decimal.

remarks.para: To use feet (and/or inches) as linear units, set property to either Architectural (feet and inches) or Engineering (feet and fractional feet).

For architectural and fractional formats the property determines between horizontal, diagonal or no stacking of the numerator and denominator. For alternate dimension units this property does not exist and is covered by property .
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.FractionFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction format (corresponds to the DIMFRAC system variable). The default value is .

remarks.para: This value is relevant when the linear unit format is set to architectural or fractional.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.DimensionLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line color (corresponds to the DIMCLRD system variable). The default value is .
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.DimensionLineExtension
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line extension (corresponds to the DIMDLE system variable).

remarks.para: This value is only relevant when there are tick marks in stead of arrows at the ends of a dimension line (see ).
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.DimensionLineGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line gap (corresponds to the DIMGAP system variable).

remarks.para: This is the distance between the dimension text and dimension line when the text cuts the dimension line in two. A value smaller than zero only affects the horizontal distance. A value greather than zero affects both the horizontal and vertical distance.
Default is 0.09.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.DimensionLineIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line increment (corresponds to the DIMDLI system variable).

remarks.para: Default value is 0.38.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.DimensionLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension line weight in 100ths of millimeters (corresponds to the DIMLWD system variable). The default value is .

remarks.para: See also for values smaller than zero. For non-negative values this is the line weight in 100ths of millimeters.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.MinusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minus tolerance (corresponds to the DIMTM system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

remarks.para: The name must be set to a value unequal to null.

For and earlier the name may not contain any spaces and may not be longer than 31 characters. Each character of the name should be a letter, digit or one of the following letters: $-_*. This constraint is checked when writing the dxf file by method .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.PlusTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the plus tolerance (corresponds to the DIMTP system variable).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.PostFix
member.summary: Gets or sets the general dimension postfix (corresponds to the DIMPOST system variable). To define a pre-fix, use the "<>" string as a place holder for the measurement. For example value "mm" would be shown as a postfix, "A<>B" would show A as prefix and B as postfix. When the postfix ends with the string "\X", the alternate dimension units are shown on the next line rather than on the same line as the primary dimension units.

remarks.para: Property is the counterpart for alternate dimension units.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyle.Rounding

member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch
member.summary: Represents a hatch pattern entity.

remarks.para: To define the hatch border, objects must be defined and added to .

There are two types of hatch filling: solid and pattern fill. To create a pattern fill hatch, set property . To create a solid fill hatch, set property to null (the default). Note that when the system variable FILLMODE () is set to false, hatches are not displayed.
A pattern can be either created from code or by reading from a pattern file (see ).
The object coordinate system is defined by the and .
This entity was introduced in release 14.

member.summary: Get the polylines which build the hatching pattern.
member.param: Will be set to true when there will be too many hatch lines created.
member.returns: Resulting hatch lines or code null if there is no hatch pattern, there are no boundaries or too many hatch lines will be created.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch.CombineSeeds(WW.Math.Geometry.Polyline2D[])
member.summary: Combine seeds with possibly also combined boundaries.
member.remarks: It is allowed to define seed points differently for different parts of the hatch. This method is trying to connect seed points with the boundaries to which they belong. Eg an O shape can only be hatched in one go, so if the hatch contains an H boundary with a seed point inside and two circle boundaries with same center but different radius and a second seed which is inside the larger circle, but outside the smaller, this method will return one pair of the seed point inside the H together with the H boundary and the second seed point together with both O boundaries.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch.HatchPatternType
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch pattern type (default is HatchPatternType.UserDefined.

remarks.para: This property does not affect the display of the hatch pattern. It merely indicates the original source of the hatch pattern.
AutoCAD allows a user to select predefined hatch patterns with names like e.g. "ANGLE" and "ESCHER". These patterns are not included in CadLib.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch style (default is HatchStyle.Normal).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch.Pattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the .

remarks.para: The pattern may be null. If null then solid fill is applied to the hatch.

When setting a pattern, the pattern is cloned. When scaling the hatch the local cloned version of the pattern is rescaled (see property ). When rotating the pattern, the clone version is rotated (see property ).
Takes over the DxfPattern.Name as the hatch pattern if the pattern has a name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the end angle (radians). The end parameter is calculated from the end angle using , which is used to calculate the ellipse points. The end point is defined as: Center + MajorAxisEndPoint * cos(EndParameter) + MinorAxisEndPoint * sin(EndParameter).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch.BoundaryPath.EllipseEdge.MinorToMajorRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets ratio between minor and major axis (default value is 1).
member.remarks: Value should not be larger than 1.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfHatch.BoundaryPath.EllipseEdge.StartAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the start angle (radians). The start parameter is calculated from the start angle using , which is used to calculate the ellipse points. The start point is defined as: Center + MajorAxisEndPoint * cos(StartParameter) + MinorAxisEndPoint * sin(StartParameter).

member.summary: Gets or sets the style, for CadLib internal use only.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMText.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text value.
member.remarks:
This text may contain special processing sequences. Not all possible sequences are supported yet.
Supported processing sequences (note the the char after the backslash should be uppercase):
\ Use the backslash escape for the following characters: \{}~
\An;
Vertical alignment: 0 = bottom, 1 = middle, 2 = top.
\Cnnn;
Set indexed color; nnn is the color index.
\cnnnn;
Set true color; nnn is the color's BGR value (8 bits per color component).
\P New line.
\FFONTNAME; Replace FONTNAME with the font name (e.g. romant.shx, Arial or Times New Roman). In case of shx fonts it's the font file name, in case of true type fonts it's the font name.
\U[+]nnnn;
DxfInsert a unicode character; nnnn is the unicode character number. If the plus sign is specified then nnnn is hexadecimal, otherwise decimal.
\Hffff;
Set new text height to ffff. Append an x to get a factor from the previous text height. So \H0.7x; reduces the text height to 70%.
{block} Curly braces indicate that the prefixed settings only apply to this block.
\L Start underlining.
\l End underlining.
\O Start overlining.
\o End overlining.
\Qnnn; Oblique angle (degrees), e.g. \Q20;.
\S Stacking: e.g. \Sx/y: (horizontal divisor line), \Sx^y: (x stacked above y, no divisor line), \Sx#4: (diagonal divisor line).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMText.SimplifiedText
member.summary: Gets a simplified version of the text without escape sequences.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMText.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference rectangle width. The default value is zero.
member.remarks: Obsolete: use instead. A line break will result when a line exceeds this width, unless this value is zero.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.Annotations.DxfScale.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone of the same source object a new CloneContext instance has to be used. For cloning multiple objects once only one CloneContext is needed (as demonstrated in the example below).

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3D
member.summary: Represents a class to draw 3D wireframe graphics onto a 2D plane using WPF.

remarks.para: This class uses and objects. For better performance, use , which uses objects instead of objects. Visual objects are lighterweight objects than objects, from which inherits. For conversion to XAML, use the .

For display of lines on screen, it is important to set a proper value so a fitting pen stroke thickness can be calculated. So if e.g. the Canvas.RenderTransform is set such to scale the drawing by a factor of 10, also the stroke thickness is scaled by the same factor.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3D.CreateDrawables(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout)
member.summary: Creates framework elements for given DXF model using specified layout (see property ).

remarks.para: The old framework elements are cleared before creating the new ones.

The entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the view ports in specified layout. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3D.CreateDrawables(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport})
member.summary: Creates framework elements for given DXF model using given view port (see property ).

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.summary: Creates framework elements for given dxf model using given view port (see property ).

The entities in model space to draw.
The entities in model space to draw.
The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.WpfWireframeGraphics3D.FrameworkElementTagger
member.summary: Gets or sets the framework element tagger.

remarks.para: Whenever a framework element is created, the currently set framework element tagger is called with the entity (including its context) from which the element is created, and returns the tag to be set to the element's property.
The following taggers are already defined:
which does set the tag to null.
which does set the tag to the entity. This is the default.
which does set the tag to the effective layer of the entity.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.ScaledLineTypeDashStrokePreparer
member.summary: A stroke preparer which sets the dash pattern of the stroke from the scaled dash pattern of the line. Use the method as to create dashed strokes.

remarks.para: This will map the DXF line type of the entity to dashes by scaling the linetype to the dash pattern length defined in the constructors, and then creating the desired dashes. DXF line types may contain dots which are considered of having zero length, which is not possible in WPF. So dots have to be susbtituted by short dashes. Their length may be defined in the constructor, too. For each dot the rest of the pattern will be shrinked a bit, so the desired overall length is kept. A special switch allows to round up all created dash and gap lengths to integer values, possibly creating an improved appearance.
This preparer will not dash the lines created from text objects (usually appearing when the text uses a SHX font).

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.ScaledLineTypeDashStrokePreparer.#ctor(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Length of the created dash patterns, has to be greater than 1.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.ScaledLineTypeDashStrokePreparer.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Length of the dot substitution dash.
Length of the created dash patterns, has to be greater than .
Round values up so dashes and gaps have integer lengths? This may enlarge the whole pattern.
member.exception: dotLength has to be less than dashPatternLength!

member.summary: Prepares the stroke.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.BaseWireframeGraphicsFactory
member.summary: Base implementation.

remarks.para: This class serves as a base implementation. In its current form it doesn't do anything, but it's meant to be derived and used as a converter from entities to coordinates of line segment.

To get line segment coordinates of a or e.g. a the following must be done:
Create a object and pass a graphics factory as a parameter to its constructor.
Draw a using method or an using method . Pass the object as a parameter. The model/entity will draw itself on the graphics factory.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.PolygonClipper
member.summary: Clipper implementation based on a polygonal prism.
member.remarks: Currently it is assumed that always the internal part of the prism is kept, which is not necessarily true in AutoCAD. Furthermore there is no front nor back clipping support due to lack of test data.

member.summary: Check a bounding box for clipping.
member.remarks: This may allow shortcuts, when bounds calculation is cheap or may be precalculated. In the case of returning no handling of the objects making up the bounds is necesary, in the case of returning the objects making up the bounds can be handled without caring for clipping.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfVPort
member.summary: Represents a viewport in model space. Similar to but several DxfVPort objects make up a screen configuration.

remarks.para: The viewport does not need to be unique. Entries with the same name indicate a multiple-viewport configuration. The entries corresponding to the active viewport configuration all have the name *ACTIVE. The first such entry describes the current viewport, which determines the viewport when the drawing is opened.
Properties , and optionally the (if is ) determine the transformation to the display coordinate system (DCS).
The viewport's must be greater than zero.

member.summary: Name of an active . Note that there can be more than 1 active view ports.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfVPort.GetTransform(WW.Math.Size2D)
member.summary: Calculates the transform for transforming the model to paper space.
member.remarks: This is no general purpose method for getting the transformation necessary to display this VPORT to the screen or elsewhere. See for more general transformations.
member.param: The size of the target window that the viewport is rendered into. The absolute size is not relevant, but the ratio between size and width determines the camera distance.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfVPort.GetMappingTransform(WW.Math.Geometry.Rectangle2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the projection transformation which uses the projection defined by this view and maps the result into a given rectangle.

remarks.para: This internally uses where more detailed information is provided.

A might define viewport configurations. Viewport configurations allow to combine s on a screen, and are identified because all related s share the same name. Using the same target rectangles for these s will return the correct transformations, but to handle everything correctly clipping is also necessary. To create a bitmap from a viewport configuration use . Effective clipping depends on the target system, so there is no general way to define it, but the code of the above bitmap creation method is given here to help with own implementations:

member.param: Target rectangle. If it does not have the aspect ratio of the view, the view is centered.
Invert the Y direction? This is necessary for target devices where Y points down like screens.
member.returns: Transformation matrix which maps the view centered into the given rectangle. The matrix will not be invertable for perspective views.

member.remarks: The allowed range is 1-20000. The circle zoom percentage controls how precise curve renderings (circles, arcs etc) are. The higher the value, the more precise (and slower) the rendering.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfVPort.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the viewport name.

remarks.para: The viewport name is not unique. Entries with the same name indicate a multiple-viewport configuration. The entries corresponding to the active viewport configuration all have the name *ACTIVE. The first such entry describes the current viewport.

For and earlier the name may not contain any spaces and may not be longer than 31 characters. Each character of the name should be a letter, digit or one of the following letters: $-_*. This constraint is checked when writing the dxf file by method .

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfTableGeometry
member.summary: Represents a geometry.

remarks.para: This class is used internally only, this class is not intended to be created/modified by the user.
This class was introduced in AutoCAD 2008.
CadLib supports reading/writing table geometry as is, but does not create it for new tables. The table geometry is optional and does not need to be present in a DXF/DWG file.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.DxfExtendedData.Bracket
member.summary: A opening/closing bracket value for .
member.remarks: Normally CadLib interprets brackets and creates nested instances for the data enclosed in the brackets. However for files for which the brackets don't match correctly, this cannot be done, and CadLib reverts to representing the brackets as is. When creating extended data programmatically, use of is preferred as it ensures correctly matched brackets.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfTable
member.summary: The table entity with which tabular data can be represented.

remarks.para: By default when adding rows, the first row's gets assigned the , the second row gets assigned and subsequence rows get assigned the . The row/cell/cell content cell style instance may be changed, but must be present in .

The easiest way to setup a table is to create a DxfTable instance, and set the and . This will populate the and and create instances. Each cell can be accessed through the property. Too add content to a cell, create a instance and add it to . The contents collection also has Add overloads to facilitate adding contents.

The table entity has a containing the visual representation of the table data. Whenever a change is made to the table, method should be called to regenerate this block. When the block is not yet generated, it is generated automatically when the is written to file.
The table entity was introduced in AutoCAD 2005.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfTable.GenerateBlock
member.summary: Generates the that contains the visual representation of the

remarks.para: If a block is not present yet, an anonymous is created and added to the model to which the table belongs. If a block was already present it is cleared and refilled with new entities.
When writing a DXF file the block is automatically generated if it was not present yet.
Call this method only if the table is part of a .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfTable.DrawLines(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Math.Matrix4D,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfTableBorder}},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfTableBorder}})
member.summary: Draws the horizontal lines, given the specified borders for all the columns of a row.

The top horizontal line of a double line is interrupted by connecting vertical double lines of the cells above (if they are there). The left and right coordinates are affected by whether the connecting vertical borders are double lines or not.

The bottom horizontal line of a double line is interrupted by connecting vertical double lines of the cells below (if they are there). The left and right coordinates are affected by whether the connecting vertical borders are double lines or not.
Draws single horizontal cell borders. The left and right coordinates are affected by whether the connecting vertical borders are double lines or not.

The left vertical line of a double line is interrupted by connecting horizontal double lines of the cells to the left (if they are there). The top and bottom coordinates are affected by whether the connecting horizontal borders are double lines or not.

The bottom horizontal line of a double line is interrupted by connecting vertical double lines of the cells below (if they are there). The left and right coordinates are affected by whether the connecting vertical borders are double lines or not.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfTable.DrawSingleVerticalLines(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Math.Matrix4D,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfTableBorder}},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfTableBorder}})
member.summary: Draws single vertical cell borders. The top and bottom coordinates are affected by whether the connecting horizontal borders are double lines or not.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.EntityColor
member.summary: Represents an entity color. An entity color has a color type and optional color value (index, RGB). See also for a number of standard colors.
member.remarks:
Use one of the following to get an entity color:
, or .
Create an ACI color from a color index value. ACI stands for AutoCAD Color Index. See method . A number of often used ACI colors can be found in class .
Create an RGB color using method or one of its overloads.
