member.returns: Transformed and possibly clipped result shape.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ClippingTransformerChain.SetPreTransform(WW.Math.Matrix4D)
member.summary: Applies given transform (pre) before all other transforms.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ClippingTransformerChain.TryIsInside(WW.Math.Bounds3D)
member.summary: Check a given volume for its clipping.
member.remarks: This method may not be exact, but provides a good means for optimization.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ClippingTransformerChain.IsInside(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape4D)
member.summary: Check a shape how it is clipped.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless and it is much better to use the method directly. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.
member.param: Shape to check for clipping, possibly changed during the check.

member.summary: Gets the 3x3 matrix for transforming a line segment before line type is applied to it. Line type is applied in the world coordinate system (for model space), or in paper space, but the perspective transformation component is omitted from this matrix.

Its height is defined by property .
Its position is defined by properties , , and . The second alignment point should only be omitted if the alignment is left, baseline.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text.

member.summary: Gets a simplified version of the text without escape sequences.

member.summary: Gets or sets the the text style. By default it is set to the "STANDARD" text style.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the text height. The height corresponds with the font ascent. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.WidthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the width factor (the default value is 1).

remarks.para: The doesn't have any effect on the text's rendering but is used only serves as a default value for this property when text is created. CadLib doesn't do this automatically, the programmer has to get the text style's width factor and set this property explicitly if desired.
This value is also adjusted when fit-type text is used.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rotation in radians. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the oblique angle in radians. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.AlignmentPoint1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first alignment point (in OCS).
member.remarks: The first alignment point corresponds to the left baseline corner of the text rectangle. This coordinate is redundant for any alignment other than left, baseline. In these cases it can be derived from , , and font characteristics.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.AlignmentPoint2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second alignment point, optional. In OCS, but after rotation.

remarks.para: The second alignment point location in the text rectangle depends on the and . E.g. if the horizontal alignment is center, then the second alignment point points to the horizontal center of the text rectangle.
The second alignment point should only be omitted if the alignment is left, baseline.

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment (the default value is ).
member.remarks: The horizontal alignment defines the horizontal placement of the text relative to .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment (the default value is ).
member.remarks: The vertical alignment defines the vertical placement of the text relative to .

member.summary: Get the transformation from the internal coordinate system into the surrounding world.
member.remarks: Because this TEXT entity may be part of a BLOCK, more transformations may be used on it before it is eventually place in the model.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.InUcsTransform
member.summary: Get the part of the transformation which happens in UCS, before the alignment point translation is added.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfText.TextBounds
member.summary: Gets the internal bounding box defined by the text of this TEXT entity.
member.remarks: The internal bounding box is in the coordinate system of this TEXT. Use to transform this to the place defined by this text. And note that this TEXT may be part of a BLOCK, which could add further transformations, and may have a Thickness, which will influence it's bounding box, too.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig
member.summary: This class contains the configuration for graphics rendering.
member.remarks: The graphics rendering behaviour is determined by this object, for better performance, the number of approximation line segments can be decreased. For better precision but slower speed, increase these numbers (e.g. , ).

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig
member.summary: Transformation configuration.
member.remarks: This class provides settings used during transformation of entities.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.TreatAttributesAsPartOfInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to treat attributes as part of insert when transforming the insert. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When e.g. drawing a selection rectangle around an insert, this determines whether the insert's attributes are included in this rectangle or excluded.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.HatchPatternHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets how to handle the pattern inside a hatch area. The default is , i.e. the pattern is transformed with the hatch.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.HatchPatternTransform
member.summary: Flags for hatch pattern handling.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.HatchPatternTransform.DontTransform
member.summary: Don't transform the hatch pattern. This will only transform the hatch boundary.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.HatchPatternTransform.OnlyTranslate
member.summary: Apply translation to pattern.
member.remarks: Using only this flag might be useful for badly constructed patterns, where high repetitions are no longer matching.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig.HatchPatternTransform.CompleteTransform
member.summary: Apply complete transformation to pattern.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.AcadLikeWithBlackBackground
member.summary: Use this as a default configuration for black backgrounds.

remarks.para: It will use the same colors as AutoCAD is using for black backgrounds, which is also known as the "classic" color set. This will also take care that no indexed color will be the same as the background color.
This object is readonly, use for a modifiable version.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.AcadLikeWithWhiteBackground
member.summary: Use this as a default configuration for white backgrounds.

remarks.para: It will use the same colors as AutoCAD is using for black backgrounds, which is also known as the "classic" color set. This will also take care that no indexed color will be the same as the background color.
This object is readonly, use for a modifiable version.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.BlackBackground
member.summary: Outdated configuration with a black background color (this object is read only).
member.remarks: Obsolete: Use instead.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.BlackBackgroundCorrectForBackColor
member.summary: The default configuration with a black background color (this object is read only). The foreground color is inverted when equal to the background color.

remarks.para: This object is readonly, use for a modifiable version.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.WhiteBackground
member.summary: The default configuration with a white background color (this object is read only).

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.WhiteBackgroundCorrectForBackColor
member.summary: The default configuration with a white background color (this object is read only). The foreground color is inverted when equal to the background color.

remarks.para: This object is readonly, use for a modifiable version.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.ShowDisabledLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show disabled layers (see ). The default value is false.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.ShowFrozenLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show frozen layers. The default value is false.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.ShowDimensionDefinitionPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show the dimension definition points (mainly for debugging). The default value is false.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.DisplayLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to display the line weight. The default value is true.

remarks.para: The drawings's settings can be used by setting this property to the value of . Get the header from .
When set to false GDIGraphics3D uses properties TextPenWidth and NontTextPenWidth to draw lines.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.DefaultLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the default line weight in 100th of mm. The default value is 0.25 mm.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.DisplayLineTypeElementShapes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display line type element shapes (see ). The default value is false. At the moment CadLib's rendering isn't optimized to display large number of shapes, therefore this feature is disabled by default.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.DotsPerInch
member.summary: Gets or sets the dots per inch. This value is used for determining the pen width depending on e.g. . The default value is 100.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.CorrectColorForBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to correct color for the background color. Default value is true.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.IndexedColors
member.summary: Get the color mapping for indexed colors.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.FixedForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fixed foreground color. The value is null if the foreground color is not fixed.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.NodeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the node size in pixels when showing nodes. The default value is 6 pixels.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.NodeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the node color.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.TryDrawingTextAsText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to try drawing text as text (default is false).
member.remarks: When e.g. rendering to PDF, text may be rendered as line segments (the default) or as PDF text. The graphics object must support text for this option to have effect, see .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.DrawImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to draw images (default value is true).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.MaxLineTypeRepeatCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the max repeat count of a line type when applied to an entity. In case the maximum is exceeded, the line type is not applied. The default value is 1000.
member.remarks: Sometimes an entity is very large compared to the total length of a line type pattern, potentially resulting in a single line being split into thousands of line segments. Use this setting to limit the amount of line segments produced for better performance.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.MaxHatchPatternRepeatCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the max hatch pattern repeat count. The default value is 100,000.
member.remarks: Sometimes a hatch is very large compared to the hatch pattern. This property controls the maximum limit for the pattern repeat count. When this limit is exceeded, the hatch is drawing using a solid color.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.HatchOverflowHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch overflow handling. The default is .
member.remarks: This property describes what happens if the limit is met.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.UseSpatialFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets how to handle spatial filters.
member.remarks: Spatial filters are used in AutoCAD to clip away entities from insertions. At the moment spatial filters are only supported in and rendering.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.UseSortEntsTables
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to reorder entities during drawing.

remarks.para: AutoCAD uses objects associated with blocks to draw entities in a different order, which changes the visual stacking order according to the socalled Painter's Algorithm.
If this property is set to true, entities of a block are reordered during drawing if there is an associated with a block, otherwise the entities are drawn in file order.
In AutoCAD the decision whether sorting is used or not is determined by the settings of the header's .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this object is read only.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.PlotStyleManager
member.summary: Get or sets the plot style manager. The default is null, i.e. no manager.

remarks.para: If a plot style manager is defined, it is used for defining color and other properties for plotting an entity.
If it is defined, the following settings are no longer used (but it is possible to imitate their behavior by defining an appropriate PlotStyleManager): ,

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.OleImageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the image size for OLE objects. The default value is 200.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig.TreatAttributesAsPartOfInsert
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to treat attributes as part of insert when transforming the insert. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When e.g. drawing a selection rectangle around an insert, this determines whether the insert's attributes are included in this rectangle or excluded.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.IndexedColorHandling
member.summary: How to handle indexed colors, especially with respect to background colors.
member.remarks: Most colors in AutoCAD are based on an indexed color model using a set of 255 colors.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.IndexedColorHandling.BehaveLikeAutocad
member.summary: Try to mimick handling indexed colors the way AutoCAD is doing.
member.remarks: AutoCAD is doing a quite complex color selection for indexed colors, depending on the background color.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.IndexedColorHandling.BehaveLikeClassicCadlibWithoutBackgroundCorrection

member.name: F:WW.Cad.Drawing.IndexedColorHandling.BehaveLikeClassicCadlibWithBackgroundCorrection
member.summary: Behave like CadLib until version *.*.34.80, with correction for background colors.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfTable2005
member.summary: Represents the obsolete AutoCAD 2005 table data structure. The table entity with which tabular data can be represented.

remarks.para: A table has an optional title row and an optional header row (for the column headers). Either one can be suppressed using the and flags. All subsequent rows are data rows. The title row, header row and data row cells have a instances from the associated with them, see , and .

The easiest way to setup a table is to create a DxfTable instance, and set the and . This will populate the and and create instances. Each cell can be accessed through the property. To change a cell's contents, set it's ValueFormat and Value.
The table entity was introduced in AutoCAD 2005.
Currently only by row/column cell styles are supported.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfAttributeDefinition
member.summary: Represents an attribute definition that serves as a template for the entity.

remarks.para: Attribute definition visibility is determined by property and DxfHeader.AttributeVisibility. When an attribute definition is part of a block, then the attribute definition is not displayed.

When adding an attribute definition to a , CadLib (upon writing the DXF file) automatically sets the DxfBlock.Flags to include BlockFlags.HasNonConstantAttributeDefinitions so AutoCAD prompts to enter an attribute value when the block is inserted. This happens only in case the block has an attribute definition that is not .

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfRegion
member.summary: Represents an ACIS based entity used to represent 2D data. See the class for 3D ACIS data.
member.remarks: Rendering of regions is partially supported.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfModelerGeometry
member.summary: Represents a base class for all entities making use of the ACIS extension for AutoCAD.
member.remarks: The ACIS library was added to AutoCAD R13 for better support of 3D features like boolean geometry. The entities in the DXF/DWG file which represent ACIS data are just a thin wrapper around the internal textual format of ACIS, which is termed SAT. Each ACIS based entity is containing the content of a complete SAT file as encrypted text.

member.summary: Transform the entity.

remarks.para: Depending on the entity not all transformations can be possibly. E.g. a non-uniform scaling of a circle would create an ellipse, thereby changing the entity type.

Overriding methods must add the action to the undoStack only if it succeeded. If it succeeded partially (in case of child actions), the undoStack should contain the successful child actions that succeeded, so they can be rolled back.

member.param: Stack for adding an undo operation for the changes done by the transforamtion.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockUserParameter.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.summary: Draw a path.
member.remarks: The path is not considered to be from at text.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ClippingPathDrawerWrapper.DrawPath(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape2D,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Drawing.ArgbColor,System.Int16,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Draw a path.
member.param: is this a path created from a text?
either 0 or the extrusion in z direction before transformation

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ClippingPathDrawerWrapper.DrawCharPath(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape2D,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Drawing.ArgbColor,System.Int16,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Draw a path for a character.
member.param: path to draw. Is assumed to be the same shape instance for the same character of a font so based on this it can be used as a key for e.g. a cache lookup.
either 0 or the extrusion in z direction before transformation

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ClippingPathDrawerWrapper.IsSeparateCharDrawingPreferred
member.summary: Is this drawer gaining from drawing separate chars rather than drawing complete strings?
member.remarks: Usually a complete string is draw as one path. Splitting this into single paths for each letter is an order N algorithm (N being the number of letters), so if the drawer works with less effiency depending on the number of paths/points involved (N log N or worse) it should return true here. But be sure to test both cases with a TTF text intensive file because sometimes the memory overhead of creating all new paths eat up the gain.
member.returns: true if this drawer gains from small filled paths, false otherwise

member.summary: Gets or sets the gaps tree lowest right node id.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2004.FileHeader.Header2Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the header 2 offset. The header 2 is a repetition of the file header data at the end of the file.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2004.Compressor
member.summary: DWG 2004 uses a variation on the LZ77 compression algorithm.
member.remarks: Hashing is used to speed up for data lookups, so no sliding window is used. Note that because of this optimization not necessarily the longest match is found (favors speed over compression).

member.summary: OpenGL control that performs a surface rendering of a .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.OpenGL.GLGraphics3D.CreateDrawables(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Math.Matrix4D)
member.summary: Create drawable objects for given dxf model from entities in model space.

remarks.para: Old drawables are cleared before creating the new ones.
Entities that are in paper space are not drawn.
These drawable objects are stored and are later drawn using OpenGL in the method.

member.param: The transform to apply to the model.

remarks.para: Old drawables are cleared before creating the new ones.

member.param: The transform to apply to the model.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate
member.summary: Delegate for entity filtering as used by the class.
member.param: The draw context parameter may be null. If not null it can be used to e.g. find the entity's effective layer if it is the by block layer and it is part of an inserted block.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector
member.summary: Utility class for selecting entities.

remarks.para: Entities can be selected with methods and .
A custom filter can be implemented by implementing and letting the filter decide what to return. This can be used to e.g. select entities outside a rectangle.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector.GetClosestEntities(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the closest entities to specified 2D reference point.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The reference point to compare with.
The filter delegate to filter out entities to take into consideration (return true to include the entity). When null the default method is used.
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that meet the proximity criteria. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then compared to given 2D reference point. This method can e.g. be used to get the closest entity to the mouse position.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector.GetClosestEntities(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity},WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the closest entities to specified 2D reference point.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The reference point to compare with.
The filter delegate to filter out entities to take into consideration (return true to include the entity). When null the default method is used.
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that meet the proximity criteria. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then compared to given 2D reference point. This method can e.g. be used to get the closest entity to the mouse position.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector.GetClosestEntities(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the closest entities to specified 2D reference point.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The reference point to compare with.
The filter delegate to filter out entities to take into consideration (return true to include the entity). When null the default method is used.
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that meet the proximity criteria. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then compared to given 2D reference point. This method can e.g. be used to get the closest entity to the mouse position.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector.GetEntitiesCloseToPoint(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Math.Point2D,System.Double,WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate)
member.summary: Gets the closest entities to specified 2D reference point.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The reference point to compare with.
The test square width. All entities that have a closest point within the square with this width and centered around the reference point are returned.
The filter delegate to filter out entities to take into consideration (return true to include the entity). When null the default method is used.
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that meet the proximity criteria. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then compared to given 2D reference point. This method can e.g. be used to get the closest entity to the mouse position.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.EntitySelector.GetEntitiesInRectangle(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Math.Geometry.Rectangle2D,WW.Cad.Drawing.EntityFilterDelegate)
member.summary: Gets the entities enclosed in specified 2D rectangle.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The filter delegate to filter out entities to take into consideration (return true to include the entity).
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then tested for containment in given 2D rectangle. Only entities are selected that fit completely in the rectangle. This method can e.g. be used to get the entities in a rectangle region defined by mouse interaction.
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that meet the proximity criteria. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.

member.summary: Gets the filtered entities using the specified filter.
member.param: The graphics configuration object determining aspects like precision.
The filter to filter the entities. The filter itself must store the filtered entities and the entity selector must be able to access these through its property
member.returns: A list of rendered entities that is filtered by the filter. Each rendered entity contains information about the entity, the transformation matrix that was used to render it and optionally has a parent. The parent is typically an insert, dimension or leader entity. Inserts may be nested multiple levels deep, thus leading to a parent chain.
member.remarks: Entities are first transformed by given transformation and transformed points are then compared to given 2D reference point. This method can e.g. be used to get the closest entity to the mouse position.

member.summary: Represents an entity filter interface used by the entity selector. Custom implementations may do arbitrary filtering like e.g. selecting entities that are outside a certain rectangle (a form of clipping).
member.remarks: Entity selection is done by drawing and letting the filter decide what entity is filtered based on the geometrical information of what is drawn for the entity.

member.summary: Transforms and clips a generic shape.

member.returns: Transformed and possibly clipped result shape.

member.summary: Applies given transform (pre) before all other transforms.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ModelSpaceClippingTransformer.TryIsInside(WW.Math.Bounds3D)
member.summary: Check a given volume for its clipping.
member.remarks: This method may not be exact, but provides a good means for optimization.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ModelSpaceClippingTransformer.IsInside(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape4D)
member.summary: Check a shape how it is clipped.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless and it is much better to use the method directly. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.

member.summary: Gets the 3x3 matrix for transforming a line segment before line type is applied to it. Line type is applied in the world coordinate system (for model space), or in paper space, but the perspective transformation component is omitted from this matrix.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides
member.summary: Represents overrides.

remarks.para: Note that overridden colors are limited to indexed colors (see ).

Dimension styles are an ever evolving feature which get additional properties with nearly each release of the formats. This means that not all features are supported in all versions. Refer to the documentation of each property to see if it is supported for your required save version or not.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides.LinearScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear measurements scale factor (corresponds to the DIMLFAC system variable).

remarks.para: If the scale factor is negative, then the (positive) scale factor is only applied to paper space dimensions.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides.LinearUnitFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for all dimension types except angular (corresponds to the DIMLUNIT system variable). Default value is LinearUnitFormat.Decimal.

remarks.para: To use feet (and/or inches) as linear units, set property to either Architectural (feet and inches) or Engineering (feet and fractional feet).

For architectural and fractional formats the property determines between horizontal, diagonal or no stacking of the numerator and denominator. For alternate dimension units this property does not exist and is covered by property .
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides.FractionFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for all dimension types except angular (corresponds to the DIMLUNIT system variable). Default value is LinearUnitFormat.Decimal.

remarks.para: To use feet (and/or inches) as linear units, set property to either Architectural (feet and inches) or Engineering (feet and fractional feet).
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides.PostFix
member.summary: Gets or sets the general dimension postfix (corresponds to the DIMPOST system variable). To define a pre-fix, use the "<>" string as a place holder for the measurement. For example value "mm" would be shown as a postfix, "A<>B" would show A as prefix and B as postfix. When the postfix ends with the string "\X", the alternate dimension units are shown on the next line rather than on the same line as the primary dimension units.

remarks.para: Property is the counterpart for alternate dimension units.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfDimensionStyleOverrides.TickSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the tick size (corresponds to the DIMTSZ system variable).

remarks.para: The tick size defines the distance the tick extends beyond the extension lines, parallel to the dimension line.
If non zero, then diagonal tick marks are drawn at the ends of the dimension line. Otherwise arrows of size are drawn.
Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.PsExporter.Draw(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport},WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D)
member.summary: Draw given dxf model on the PostScript stream using given view port.

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The view ports to use for rendering (optional).
The configuration that steers the drawing.
Transform from paper space to PostScript paper space.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Text.IDrawableCanonicalGlyph
member.summary: A canonical glyph, i.e. a character of a font defined by its rendering path and its advance vector.
member.remarks: Canonical means that the character is defined for font size 1, with an aspect ratio of 1 and no slant. Please note that some fonts allow letter spacing to depend on adjoining letters. This interface is not taking care of this.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockPointParameter.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter
member.summary: Count entities types and create a statistics from the results.

example.para: The following will print out a statistics of all entities in the model space and paper space:

member.para: Please note that the above is basically doing a tree walk over the whole model, which means that entities in blocks may be counted more than once when their block is inserted more than once.
If you are only interested in the number of entities in the file, you can use the method.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.
member.remarks: This will create a deep counter which also counts entities in inserted blocks and vertices. It will count both model and paper space entities.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.#ctor(WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.HandlingFlags,WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.SpaceFlags)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Flags describing how to handle linked or associated entities.
Filter for paper and model space entities.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.GetFileEntityCounts(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,System.String)
member.summary: Get the flat counts of all entities in the model.
member.remarks: This will count all entities in the ENTITIES section and all entities in the BLOCKS section. Each entity will only be called once. The resulting values give the number of single entities as will appear in a DWG or DXF file created from the model.
member.param: The model for which the entity counts are calculated.
If not null an entry with this label and the sum of all entities will be appended to the resulting list.
member.returns: Order list of entity types together with their counts.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.Reset
member.summary: Clear the statistics.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.Register(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity)
member.summary: Register a simple entity.
member.returns: true if the entity was registered.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.GetStatistics
member.summary: Get the statistics.
member.returns: The resulting statistics as an ordered (by entity type) list of pairs of types and the encountered counts of this type. If a type is not encountered it will not be included in the list.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.EntityCounter.GetStatisticsWithTotal(System.String)
member.summary: Get the statistics including a total count.
member.returns: The resulting statistics as an ordered (by entity type) list of pairs of types and the encountered counts of this type. If a type is not encountered it will not be included in the list. The last entry of the list contains the given and the total count of entities.

member.summary: Register a dimension entity.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.Wpf.EntityDrawable
member.summary: A container for entity drawables. In an editor scenario each entity has a geometry, which may be empty (entity is invisible) or not empty (entity is visible). By having this geometry node in the linked list of all entity drawables, the drawing order is preserved when e.g. toggling entity visibility.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.LineTypeScaler
member.summary: All of the line type scalers are immutable.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.ILineTypeScaler
member.summary: An interface to calculate the length of a vector in the OCS after it is transformed to the WCS/eye CS. Line type is applied in the WCS/eye CS, but the actual calculation happens in the OCS, which is easier as there can happen various clippings at the insert stage before the WCS is actually reached.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ILineTypeScaler.GetScaledLength(WW.Math.Vector2D)
member.summary: Transforms the specified OCS vector to the WCS/eye CS and returns its length.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ILineTypeScaler.GetScaledLength(WW.Math.Vector3D)
member.summary: Transforms the specified OCS vector to the WCS/eye CS and returns its length.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ILineTypeScaler.GetLengths(WW.Math.Vector2D,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Transforms the specified OCS vector to the WCS/eye CS and returns its length (scaled) as well as the length of the original vector.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ILineTypeScaler.ApplyWcsToOcsCorrection(WW.Math.Matrix3D)
member.summary: Applies a WCS/eye CS to OCS correction to the specified matrix. Take into account additional (non-uniform) transformations due to inserts/paper space projection transforms. Since line type is applied to OCS, and transformed to the WCS later, a correction (only scale and shear) has to be applied because the line type should appear as if it was applied in the WCS.

member.summary: Base class for line type scalers that have a shear component in them.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.IO.GroupCodes.SubClassMarker
member.summary: Subclass model marker (with derived class name as a string). Required for all objects and entity classes that are derived from another concrete class. The subclass model marker segregates model defined by different classes in the inheritance chain for the same object. This is in addition to the requirement for DXF names for each distinct concrete class derived from ObjectARX (see "Subclass Markers")

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.GetToWCSTransform(WW.Math.Vector3D)
member.summary: Calculate coordinate transformation to WCS (world coordinate system) according to given z-axis (in WCS).
member.remarks: Useful to transform coordinates from the OCS (object coordinate system) to the WCS (world coordinate system). See , subject "Arbitrary Axis Algorithm".

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.GetToWcsTransformXAxis(WW.Math.Vector3D)
member.summary: Calculate coordinate transformation to WCS (world coordinate system) according to given z-axis (in WCS) and returns its x-axis.
member.remarks: Useful to transform coordinates from the OCS (object coordinate system) to the WCS (world coordinate system). See , subject "Arbitrary Axis Algorithm".

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.GetToWCSTransform(WW.Math.Vector3D,WW.Math.Vector3D)
member.summary: Calculate coordinate transformation to WCS (world coordinate system) according to given x-axis and z-axis.
member.remarks: No check is done to ensure that given x and z axis are perpendicular to eachother.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.GetToWCSTransform2(WW.Math.Vector3D,WW.Math.Vector3D)
member.summary: Calculate coordinate transformation to WCS (world coordinate system) according to given x-axis and z-axis. Same as , but assumes given x-axis and z-axis are already normalized.
member.remarks: No check is done to ensure that given x and z axis are perpendicular to eachother.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.GetArbitraryAxisAndZRotation(WW.Math.Matrix3D,WW.Math.Vector3D@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get the arbitrary axis and an additional z rotation angle from a general rotation.
member.remarks: This is useful to determine the z rotation angle and arbitrary axis for entities.
member.param: General rotation matrix. It is assumed that the transformation really defines a rotation, i.e. its determinant is 1.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.DxfUtil.DisposeThreadStaticObjects
member.summary: Dispose all thread static objects.

remarks.para: Normally all thread static objects are released by the garbage collector when a thread ends, but method Dipose is not called on objects. With this method these disposable objects can be explicitly disposed of at the end of a thread.
When the thread static objects are disposed, the thread can still be used, all needed thread static objects are initialized as needed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minor to major axis ratio (default value is 1).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEllipse.StartParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the start parameter (this value is 0.0 for a full ellipse). The start point is defined as: Center + MajorAxisEndPoint * cos(StartParameter) + MinorAxisEndPoint * sin(StartParameter).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEllipse.EndParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the end parameter (this value is 2 pi for a full ellipse). The end point is defined as: Center + MajorAxisEndPoint * cos(EndParameter) + MinorAxisEndPoint * sin(EndParameter).

member.summary: Root class for the graph.
member.remarks: Containes two collections - graph nodes and graph edges. Seems that Dynamic block structure is duplicated. The first is eval graph nodes and edges. The second topology is Parameter\Grips\Actions.

member.summary: Accepts the specified visitor.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfEvalGraph.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfField
member.summary: Represents a field object with a key and value. A field contains a key value dictionary as well as child fields and objects.

remarks.para: The current implementation provides only support for reading and writing fields. At the moment there is no support for evaluation, neither automatic nor explicit. So if a field object is created from scratch, the creator has to take care that the properties of the field are in a valid state to be written to file.
A new field must be added to the .
This object was introduced in .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfField.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone of the same source object a new CloneContext instance has to be used. For cloning multiple objects once only one CloneContext is needed (as demonstrated in the example below).
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.RenderedEntityInfo
member.summary: Represents a class containing information about a rendered entity.

remarks.para: A rendered entity info object contains information about an entity, together with the transformation matrix that was used to render the entity. This transformation can be used to transform back from the rendered coordinate system back to the entity's coordinate system (by using ). This is useful when manipulating an entity with the mouse.

A rendered entity may or may not have a . If it has a parent, it may have its own associated transformation matrix. Typically a chain is formed by inserts and a block's child entities, which may recurse a number of levels.
Custom filters may need to create their own instances using method .

remarks.para: Note that a graphics path has no color nor does it has a property indicating whether it should be filled.

To draw a or e.g. a onto a GraphicsPath the following must be done:
Create a object and call , , or passing the draw context and this converter object.
Draw a using method , a using method or an using method . Pass the object as a parameter. The model/entity will draw itself on the graphics factory.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport
member.summary: The viewport entity specifies a view in paper space on model space.

remarks.para: A viewport is part of a . The transformation from model space to paper space as specified by the viewport is only applied to entities in model space (see ). Model space entities are part of the model space layout, paper space entities are part of one of the paper space layouts. There may be be zero or more paper space layouts, there is only one model space layout (). Whether a layout is a model space or paper space layout is defined by property .
A viewport is by default in paper space.
The viewport with 1 represents paper space itself and does not show the model.

The defines the position at which the camera is looking in model space. The specifies the direction in which the camera is looking. The defines the view height in model space. The defines the view center in the display coordinate system (the model is transformed to the display coordinate system according to and and optionally the perspective transform). The specifies where the viewport is placed in paper space. Finally the defines the viewport size in paper space.

member.remarks: Point (-size.Position * 0.5d, -size.Y * 0.5d, back) transforms to (0, 0, 0). Point (size.Position * 0.5d, size.Y * 0.5d, front) transforms to (1, 1, 1). (All in real space).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport.ViewportEntityHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets the viewport entity header.

remarks.para: The viewport entity header was used in releases before R15. From R15 its role is superseded by layouts, which were introduced in R15. In R15 viewport entity headers were still used for the layout associated with block "*Paper_Space". (typically "Layout1", but the name can be changed). For other layouts the viewport entity header is null.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfPolyline3DSpline
member.summary: Spline curve subtype of the 3D poly line (POLYLINE) entity, built from objects.

remarks.para: The spline can be of degree 2 (quadratic) or 3 (cubic), see property SplineType.
The spline is defined by the and its degree (SplineType).
The are derived from the control points and are required for rendering by programs that itself don't calculate the spline curve from the control points (see method ).
Use the property to specify whether the polyline should be closed.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.SvgExporter
member.summary: Class for exporting a CAD drawing to the SVG format (Scalable Vector Graphics).

remarks.para: Note that the SVG x-axis points right and the y-axis points down, and the origin is at the top left.

Depending on the constructor call used the exporter is either running in paper mode outputting real world units meant for output fitting on a paper, or in pixel mode where pixel coordinates are written. Setting or allows to switch modes, but is discouraged as some default values (eg ) depend on mode.
Generally all properties should be set before calling one of the Draw() methods.
CAD layers can be simulated by SVG groups by setting to true.
If custom XML attributes are needed inside the generated XML elements, set property to a delegate that is called for writing these XML attributes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the paper size (Default is letter).

remarks.para: See for standard paper sizes.

The exporter can work either in paper or in pixel mode, basically depending on the constructor used to create it. The mode may be implicitly set by setting the paper size using this property (afterwards the exporter is in paper mode) or the pixel size with the property (after which the exporter is in pixel mode).
When in pixel mode this returns null.

When in pixel mode this returns a size with negative width and height.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfSpatialFilter
member.summary: Represents a spatial .

remarks.para: A spatial filter defines a space volume by a 2D clip boundary polygon, which defines infinite clipping planes by elongating the edges of the polygon perpendicular to the polygon's plane (i.e. a prism). Everything outside of the volume is clipped away. The volume may be further reduced by optional front clipping and back clipping planes, which are parallel to the boundary polygon plane. The boundary polygon plane itself is given by its normal and the origin of plane coordinate system. The other axis directions of the plane cs are given by the arbitrary axis algorithm, or can be determined by the which transforms the clipping boundary points into 3D space.
Spatial filter was introduced in release 14.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.BasicEntityVisitor
member.summary: Basic do-nothing implementation of an entity visitor.

remarks.para: It is useful as a base class for writing your own entity visitor in case you are only interested in special entities.

Please be aware that entities are organized in a tree, so in order to walk the complete tree you'll need to get throw the entity walker at the sub entities of DxfDimension, DxfInsert (don't forget the Attributes), DxfTable, and DxfPolyline.

Extending from this class has the further impact that new entity types added to CadLib will not break your code because in this case this class will be adopted. This may be an advantage or disadvantage depending on the purpose of your class. As a rule of thumb extend this class if you are only interested in some special entity types, and extend the basic interface if you want to reach all entities.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout
member.summary: A layout consists of one more more objects.

remarks.para: Model space entities are part of the model space layout, paper space entities are part of one of the paper space layouts. There may be be zero or more paper space layouts, there is only one model space layout (). Whether a layout is a model space or paper space layout is defined by property .
Add viewports to the collection. The viewport with id 1 describes paper space itself. The other viewports are views on model space. See for more information class
This object was introduced in release 15.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfRasterImage.BoundaryVertices
member.summary: Gets the boundary vertices of the visible portion of the image.

remarks.para: The boundary vertices are defined in image coordinates, the origin being the center of the top left pixel of the image. The x-axis points right and the y-axis points down. Use 2 boundary vertices to indicate the opposite corners of a rectangle boundary. Use more vertices to create a polygonal boundary.
This property must be set, otherwise the image is not visible. Use method to set the default boundary vertices that shows the entire image.
However polygonal boundaries can specified, CadLib currently only renders rectangular images.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.ObjectCollectionResolver
member.summary: This class adds each object to the right DxfModel collection.
member.remarks: Still need to update DxfReader/DwgReader to use this class instead of letting those classes put each object into the right collection. The point is that some objects get the right name only when the related dictionary entry (name) is read. E.g. the TABLESTYLE name is not stored with the TABLESTYLE in DXF, but it's stored in the dictionary entry.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.EntityType
member.summary: Entity mode (entmode). Generally, this indicates whether or not the subentity relative handle reference is present.

member.name: F:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.EntityType.HasOwnerRelativeRef
member.summary:
The owner relative handle reference is present. Applies to the following: VERTEX, ATTRIB, and SEQEND. BLOCK, ENDBLK, and the defining entities in all block defs except *MODEL_SPACE and *PAPER_SPACE.
Wout, remarks on Viewport:
In R13-14: Only values 1 and 2 are used. In R15: parent handle points to the owner block record, for layout1 value = 1. In R18: it's still used, but only for Layout1 it appears.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock
member.summary: Block is a container of objects.

remarks.para: Use the entity to add a reference to a block in a drawing.

A block and its child entities are neither in paper space or model space. A block can be used in both spaces. When an references a block, and the insert is in paper space, the block and its entities are in paper space in the context of that block.
The drawing order of a block may differ from the order of the when a is associated with the block.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock.BasePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the base point.

remarks.para: The base point acts as the origin of the block, so all the block's entity coordinates are displaced with minus the base point.
If this block defines an external reference the base point is taken from the of the referenced file, and no longer changeable.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock.BaseTransformation
member.summary: Get the transformation defined by the .
member.remarks: When inserting the entities of this block you'll have to multiply the transformation given by the entity inserting this block with the transformation returned by this property (in this order) to get the complete transformation which is applied to the of this block.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock.Entities
member.summary: Gets the entities.
member.remarks: This returns the entities in file order. See to get the entities in a possibly different order defined by a associated with this block.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock.Name
member.summary: Gets the name. A block is referenced by entities by its name.

remarks.para: The name must be set to a value unequal to null.

For and earlier the name may not contain any spaces and may not be longer than 31 characters. Each character of the name should be a letter, digit or one of the following letters: $-_*. This constraint is checked when writing the DXF file by method .

member.exception: thrown when setting null value.
thrown when setting empty string value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the external reference DWG file name (without extension).

remarks.para: Only DWG files can be referenced.
This property is only used during drawing when flag is set to true. The external reference must be loaded explicitly, using method or for all blocks in the model.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext
member.summary: Represents a clone context that facilitates making clones of object graphs.

remarks.para: The clone context enables making a clone of multiple objects and fixing the object references after all objects are cloned. To resolve these references, call method after all objects have been cloned. E.g. e hatch entity may reference a circle entity as its boundary. After cloning both hatch and circle entities, this method will restore these references in the cloned objects. When cloning multiple entities from a source to a target , only one clone context instance needs to be created, with the target model as parameter. See also the example below.

The cloning of an entity (or other object) may result in cloning a referenced entity indirectly. These are gathered in . The caller should add these indirectly cloned entities to the appropriate entity collection.

Cloning to the same target model as the source model is allowed. In this case when cloning an object, any objects this object is referencing are only cloned if these objects are owned. E.g. when cloning an entity, its line type, and layer will not be cloned when cloning within the same model as the line type and layer are not owned by the entity, only referenced. On the other hand an entity's extension dictionary is owned by the entity, and will be cloned when cloning within the same model.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.#ctor(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.ReferenceResolutionType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The target model. If the target model is the same as the source model, property is set to true.
member.remarks: The target block is set to the model's model space layout block.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.GetExistingClone(WW.Cad.Model.IGraphCloneable)
member.summary: Gets the existing clone for specified source object. This method tries to find the clone in the dictionary.
member.param: object which clone is looked for
member.returns: the clone or null if no clone is found or the is null

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.IGraphCloneable)
member.summary: Clones the specified source object. Returns null when the source object is null.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.CloneTableRecord(WW.Cad.Model.Tables.ITableRecord)
member.summary: Clones the specified table record.
member.remarks: Will try to use the target model's table record with the same name if exists, otherwise will clone the table record and add it to the target model.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.RegisterClone(WW.Cad.Model.IGraphCloneable,WW.Cad.Model.IGraphCloneable)
member.summary: Registers the specified source object and clone.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.CreateNew
member.summary: Creates a new clone context based on this clone context's target model and reference resolution type.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.ResolveReferences
member.summary: Resolves references for all cloned objects if needed. E.g. e hatch entity may reference a circle entity as its boundary. After cloning both hatch and circle entities, this method will restore these references in the cloned objects. If e.g. only the hatch was cloned, the relation will not be restored.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.SourceToClonedObject
member.summary: Gets the source to cloned object dictionary.
member.remarks: This dictionary is used to be able to resolve object references after all objects are cloned.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.SourceModel
member.summary: Gets the source model.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.TargetModel
member.summary: Gets the target model.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.ReferenceResolutionType
member.summary: Gets the type of the reference resolution.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.CloneBuilders
member.summary: Gets the clone builders.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.AllowDuplicateNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether duplicate names are allowed when cloning. The default value is false.
member.remarks: E.g. duplicate names are allowed, but the user may not intend this to happen.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.RenameClashingBlocks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to rename a block when a block with that name already exists in the target drawing. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When copying a user-defined block from one model to another and there is already a block with the same name, what is about to happen? If this property is true, the block is renamed and copied, if it is false than the block reference of the already existing block with the same name is taken.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.CloneHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clone the header. Only relevant when cloning a whole model. The default value is false.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.IndirectlyClonedObjects
member.summary: Gets the indirectly cloned objects that have not yet been added to the target model.
member.remarks: Some objects are cloned indirectly, e.g. a optionally has an associated annotiation (), which gets cloned too, but which is not added automatically to any target entity collection. The caller that makes the clones should add these indirectly cloned entities to the appropriate entity collection (this could be the model entities, layout entities or block entities).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.AddDefaultReactorToDictionaryEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to add default a reactor to cloned dictionary entries. The default value is true.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext.CloneExact
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an exact copy has to be made (including handles etc). Only use this when copying a model exactly where the target model should be an identical copy of the source model.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ProxyGraphics.TransformMe(WW.Cad.Drawing.TransformConfig,WW.Math.Matrix4D,WW.Actions.CommandGroup)
member.summary: Transform the proxy graphics.

remarks.para: Depending on the entity not all transformations can be possibly. E.g. a non-uniform scaling of a circle would create an ellipse, thereby changing the entity type.

Overriding methods must add the action to the undoStack only if it succeeded. If it succeeded partially (in case of child actions), the undoStack should contain the successful child actions that succeeded, so they can be rolled back.

member.param: Stack for adding an undo operation for the changes done by the transforamtion (optional).

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation
member.summary: Represents the dynamic block lookup table column type information.
member.remarks: The class is a part of lookup functionality. Lookup functionality allows add custom parameters to dynamic blocks.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the id.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.ResourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource type. Default value is 0.
member.remarks: see also ConvertResourceTypeForEvalGraphExpression 1 - string 40 - double 70 - int16\bool 90 - int32 11 - point 91 - handle

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type. Default value is 0.
member.remarks: Actual meaning is unknown. Probably 0 - digits, 1 - angles.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.PropertyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the property type. Default value is true.
member.remarks: true - information is lookup properties. false - information is input properties.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfLookupActionInformation.Unmatched

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockAngleOffsetAction.ScaleType
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale type. Default value is ScaleTypeXY.XY.
member.remarks: Field used only if action linked with XY parameter. If value is X, it means that block can be moved only in X direction.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockAngleOffsetAction.DistanceCoefficient
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance coefficient. Default value is 1.
member.remarks: If you change the distace parameter, linked DXF entities will be moved by distance x DistanceCoefficient. So if DistanceCoefficient is 2, moving of grip by 1 will lead to moving of geometry by 2.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockAngleOffsetAction.AngleOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle offset. Default value is 0.
member.remarks: Offset for angle parameter. If it set to 90 and parameter is 10 geometry will be rotated by 100.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockAngleOffsetAction.Unknown1
member.summary: Gets or sets the unknown1. Default value is 0.
member.remarks: Field used only if action linked with XY parameter and scale type is X or Y.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockAngleOffsetAction.Unknown2
member.summary: Gets or sets the unknown2. Default value is 0.
member.remarks: Field used only if action linked with XY parameter and scale type is Y.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.WireframeGraphicsFactoryUtil.CreateDrawables(WW.Cad.Drawing.IWireframeGraphicsFactory,WW.Cad.Drawing.GraphicsConfig,WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport})
member.summary: Create drawable objects for given DXF model using specified view ports.

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.summary: Creates drawables for given model using given view ports.

remarks.para: The entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The model of which the entities are part.
The entities in model space to draw.
The entities in paper space to draw.
The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.Hatcher.CalculateIntersectionParameters(WW.Math.Geometry.Polyline2D[],WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Vector2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculate the intersection parameters of a line of infinite length and a collection of simple closed boundaries.
member.param: collection of simple closed boundary polygons
specifies whether to fill the whole interior of all borders as opposed to applying the even odd algorithm.
member.returns: array of intersection parameters (always with even length) or null if there was no intersection at all

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.Hatcher.CalcIntersection(WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Vector2D)
member.summary:
Calculate the intersection parameter of the intersection of an infinite and a finite line. This assumes the equations
start + lambda * dir = location1 + nu * (location2 - location1)
and returns lambda.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Base.Hatcher.CalcIntersection(WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Point2D,WW.Math.Vector2D)
member.summary:
Calculate the intersection parameter of the intersection of an infinite and a finite line. This assumes the equations
start + lambda * dir = location
and returns lambda.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension
member.summary: Represents an abstract dimension entity.

remarks.para: This is an abstract class, see the subclasses for the different types of dimensions.
To show feet/inches as linear dimension units, change the of the appropriate dimension style object.
The visualization of a dimension is handled by its which is generated by method upon writing a DXF file.

Take care that some of the definition points of the dimension are in object coordinate system (OCS), while others are in world coordinate system (WCS). OCS is defined by the value of the property, if it is not (0,0,1) then OCS ansd WCS differ by a rotation defined by or (the other way round) . Point properties defined in OCS have associated properties (ending with Wcs) which allow to set them in WCS. Furthermore the method allows to apply a different vector while taking care of updating OCS point properties accordingly.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.GenerateBlock
member.summary: Generates the that contains the visual representation of the dimension.

remarks.para: If a block is not present yet, an anonymous is created and added to the model to which the dimension belongs. If a block was already present it is cleared and refilled with new entities.
When writing a DXF file the block is automatically generated if it was not present yet.
Subclasses must call the superclass GenerateBlock method.
Block must be part of a when calling this method.

member.exception: Thrown when the dimension is not part of a model.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.Measurement
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual measurement.

remarks.para: The measurement value is optional. Leave at zero if measurement is to be derived from the dimension definition points.
This property was introduced in .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension text.

remarks.para: Dimension text explicitly entered by the user. Optional; default is the . If null or an empty string, the dimension is drawn as the text. The any occurrence of the string <> in the text is replaced with the dimension measurement. If (one blank space), the text is suppressed. Anything else is drawn as the text.
If the text contains the two characters '\X' all text after that is put below the dimension line.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether should be used.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.TextRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional rotation (in radians) of the dimension text away from its default orientation (the direction of the dimension line).

remarks.para: This angle is measured in radians. The default value is 0.
Setting a value also sets to true.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.HasHorizontalDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether should be used.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.HorizontalDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal direction (in radians) for the dimension entity.

remarks.para: The dimension entity determines the orientation of dimension and lines for horizontal, vertical, and rotated linear dimensions. This group value is the negative of the angle between the OCS X axis and the UCS X axis. It is always in the XY plane of the OCS.
Setting a value also sets to true.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension.ZAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the extrusion direction.

remarks.para:
Setting this to something else than the default (0,0,1) means that all points of this dimension have to be transformed with the rotation transformation defined by
in order to get their world position. This is a relict of AutoCAD starting as a 2D CAD program.

So in order to set the definition points of this dimension correctly you'll have to transform the points with the inverse of this transformation (. Please note that the points of this entity are not updated automatically when setting this property, rather use the method when this dimension is already containing useful point date.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfTextStyle.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

remarks.para: The name must be set to a value unequal to null.

For and earlier the name may not contain any spaces and may not be longer than 31 characters. Each character of the name should be a letter, digit or one of the following letters: $-_*. This constraint is checked when writing the dxf file by method .
A text style that represents a shape file may or may not have a name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the oblique angle (radians).
member.remarks: Displaying oblique angle is currently not supported.

member.summary: Gets or sets the generation flags.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this text style is backwards.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfTextStyle.IsUpsideDown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this text style is upside down.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfTextStyle.WidthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the width factor (the default value is 1).

remarks.para: For this property serves as a default value for , but other than that it is not used by . Adjusting the width factor has no effect on the text.

For this property serves as the multiline text's width factor and is used for rendering the multiline text. Adjusting the width factor affects all multiline text entities that use this text style. For the behavior is the same as for multiline text.
Displaying oblique angle is currently not supported.

Because even this path may have to be constructed, it's faster to use the method if all what is wanted is to draw the path.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockLookupAction.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline
member.summary: Represents a (rational) spline entity.

remarks.para: A spline is defined by its , , and .
A closed spline has just as many knots as an open spline (number of control points + power + 1). The closed spline is rendered just as the open spline but a closing curve is added.
This entity was introduced in release 13.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.Closed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the spline is closed. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This gets or sets the in .
A closed spline has just as many knots as an open spline (number of control points + power + 1). The closed spline is rendered just as the open spline but a closing curve is added.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.Rational
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the spline is rational.

remarks.para: This gets or sets the in .
For a rational splines the control points are weighted by its . When this flag is false the weights are ignored even if present when drawing the spline.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.IsPeriodic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spline is periodic.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.IsPlanar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spline is planar. The default value is false. When the spline is not planar, the value of is ignored.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.IsLinear
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the spline is linear. The default value is false.
member.remarks: A linear spline is also a planar spline.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSpline.Knots
member.summary: Gets the knots. Use method to create default knot values.
member.remarks: When defining a spline the number of knots should be equal to the + number of + 1 (also when the spline is closed).

member.summary: Gets or sets the control point weights.

member.summary: Gets or sets the z-axis. This value is ignored if the spline is not planar (see ).
member.remarks: The z-axis has no effect on the drawing of the splines, because all the control points are defined in world coordinates (WCS).

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfSolid
member.summary: Solid entity, built from four objects.

remarks.para: The z-coordinate of all vertices should be zero.
The fourth corner point may be the same as the third to let the solid effectively have three corners. Note that the third and fourth corner points are in opposite order.
This class also represents the obsolete cad entity TRACE.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfLwPolyline.Vertex.Bulge
member.summary: Gets or sets the bulge (optional; default is 0) for curve segment. A negative value indicates a clockwise arc, a positive value indicates a counter clockwise arc.

remarks.para: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the endpoint. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.
The bulge. contains helper methods to calculate a bulge value: and .
