member.summary: Cuts the data section into pages, compresses each page and writes each page to the main stream.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.DwgWriterR21.WriteDataSectionPageToMainStream(WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.LogicalSection,System.Byte[],System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Writes a data section page with specified page index to main stream.
member.remarks: A page must start on a position dividable by 0x20. Padding bytes are filled with random bytes. The page header from R18 has disappeared.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.DwgWriterR21.WritePage(WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.SectionPage,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a page and pads it so the page size is a multiple of 0x20 bytes. Assigns the page's Id, StreamOffset and Length.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.DwgWriterR21.RSEncode(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32,WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.ReedSolomonEncoding)
member.summary: Encode the data using Reed-Solomon. The parity bytes are written to a buffer, referenced by parityBufferPtr.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.DwgWriterR21.RSEncodeInterleaved(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32,WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.ReedSolomonEncoding)
member.summary: Encode the data using Reed-Solomon. The data is interleaved, with the interleaving space being the number of blocks n. The first block's bytes are written to position 0, n, 2 * n, 3 * n. The second block's bytes are written to position 1, n + 1, 2 * n + 1, 3 * n + 1. Etc.
member.remarks: Returns the RS block count.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.DwgWriterR21.RSEncodeBlockInterleaved(System.Byte*,System.Byte*,System.Int32,WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.ReedSolomonEncoding)
member.summary: Encode a single block. The blockCount is used as the interleaving space.

member.summary: Creates drawables for given DXF model using given view ports.

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.WireframeGraphics2Cache.GraphicsFactory.BeginInsert(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfInsert)
member.summary: Need to mark begin/end of insert in case part of the inserts child drawables are updated, e.g. attributes are updated using . That way the first and last drawable (especially the last) of the insert remain the same, otherwise the last drawable might get removed, and then the inserts reference to the last drawable is invalid.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.WireframeGraphics2Cache.GraphicsFactory.EndInsert
member.summary: Need to mark begin/end of insert in case part of the inserts child drawables are updated, e.g. attributes are updated using .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Drawing.WireframeGraphics2Cache.EntityDrawablesInfo.Children
member.summary: Gets the children. Need to know children in case a INSERT's block is updated, e.g. entities are removed from it. When the INSERT's drawables are updated the EntityDrawablesInfo for removed entities need to be removed as well.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.ViewportTransformer.IsInside(WW.Math.Geometry.IShape4D)
member.summary: Check a shape how it is clipped.
member.remarks: This is performing the whole clipping process without performing the actual clipping, so in most cases this is useless and it is much better to use the method directly. But in some circumstances like outputting text as text this method is useful to check whether a given text is clipped.
member.param: Shape to check for clipping, possibly changed during the check.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Drawing.GDI.GDIGraphics3D
member.summary: Represents a class to draw 3D graphics onto a 2D plane using GDI .

remarks.para:
Usage:
Create intermediate drawable objects (points/lines/polylines) using .
Get bounding box using method .
Calculate the scale transform needed to fit the drawing into the display rectangle using . Set the result with the property.
Draw intermediate drawable objects using .
This intermediate representation is needed to speed up drawing when interacting with the graphics (e.g. rotating, panning, zooming).
2D rendering of and is supported, but not 3D. To disable drawing of image entities set property GraphicsConfig.DrawImages to false.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.GDI.GDIGraphics3D.CreateDrawables(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport})
member.summary: Create drawable objects for given model using given view port.

remarks.para: Old drawables are cleared before creating the new ones.

Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.
These drawable objects are stored and can later be drawn to using the method.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Drawing.GDI.GDIGraphics3D.AddDrawables(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel,WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfLayout,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfViewport})
member.summary: Create drawable objects for given model using given view port.

remarks.para: Old drawables are not cleared before creating the new ones.

Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.
These drawable objects are stored and can later be drawn to using the method.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader

remarks.para: The header is part of a object and contains properties that may apply to a drawing, although most properties just define internal settings which mostly influence future behavior.
Not all properties are supported in all version, see the property documentation for supported version information.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current multiline scale. The default value is 1. This value represents system variable CMLSCALE.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the AutoCAD version (variable $ACADVER).

remarks.para: Setting this variable greatly influcences the content of the written file (DXF or DWG) and the available features.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.Elevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the elevation. The default value is 0. This value represents system variable ELEVATION.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.EndCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets the end caps. The default value is EndCaps.None. This value represents system variable ENDCAPS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.EntitySortingFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the enabled sorting modes. The default value is . This value represents system variable SORTENTS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ExtendedNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether extended names are used. This value represents system variable EXTNAMES.

item.description: Release 14 compatibility. Limits names to 31 characters in length. Names can include the letters A to Z, the numerals 0 to 9, and the special characters dollar sign ($), underscore (_), and hyphen (-).

AutoCAD 2000. Names can be up to 255 characters in length, and can include the letters A to Z, the numerals 0 to 9, spaces, and any special characters not used for other purposes by Microsoft Windows and AutoCAD

member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.FacetResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the facet resolution. The default value is 0.5. This value represents system variable FACETRES.
member.remarks: Not written to DXF, available in all supported DWG versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.FilletRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the fillet radius. The default value is 0. This value represents system variable FILLETRAD.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.FingerPrintGuid
member.summary: Gets or sets the finger print GUID. Set at creation time, uniquely identifies a particular drawing. This value represents system variable FINGERPRINTGUID.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.HaloGapPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets the gap to be displayed where an object is hidden by another object; the value is specified as a percent of one unit and is independent of the zoom level. A haloed line is shortened at the point where it is hidden when HIDE or the Hidden option of SHADEMODE is used. This value represents system variable HALOGAP.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.IndexCreationFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets whether layer and spatial indexes are created and saved in drawing files. Currently setting this variable has no influence. This value represents system variable INDEXCTL.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.InterfereColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the "interference objects" created during the interfere command. The default value is . The value represents system variable INTERFERECOLOR.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.InterfereObjectStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the object style for interference objects. The value returned/expected is a VISUALSTYLE from the objects section. This value represents system variable INTERFEREOBJVS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the view style for viewport during interference checking. The value returned/expected is a VISUALSTYLE from the objects section. This value represents system variable INTERFEREVPVS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.IntersectionColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity color of intersection polylines. The default value is (i.e. the BYENTITY color). This value represents system variable INTERSECTIONCOLOR.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.IntersectionDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets the display of intersection polylines. Default is false. This value represents system variable INTERSECTIONDISPLAY.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ObscuredColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity color of obscured lines. The default value is (i.e. the BYENTITY color). This value represents system variable OBSCOLOR.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ObscuredLineType
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type of obscured lines. The default value is , i.e. no obscured lines are displayed. This value represents system variable OBSLTYPE.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ProjectName
member.summary: Gets or sets the project name. The project name is used when an external reference or image is not found on its original path. The project name points to a section in the registry that can contain one or more search paths for each project name defined. The default value is the empty string (i.e. no project name). This value represents system variable PROJECTNAME.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ProxyGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to save proxy object images. The default is true. This value represents system variable PROXYGRAPHICS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.InsUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing-units value for automatic scaling of blocks, images, or xrefs inserted or attached to a drawing. The default value is Inches. This value represents system variable INSUNITS.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.LinearUnitFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear unit format. The default value is Decimal. This value represents system variable LUNIT.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.LinearUnitPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear unit precision. The default value is 4. This value represents system variable LUPREC.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.LineTypeScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type scale. The default value is 1. This value represents system variable LTSCALE.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show spline control points. The default value is false. This value represents system variable SPLFRAME.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.NumberOfSplineSegments
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of spline segments for spline approximation. The default value is 8. This value represents system variable SPLINESEGS.
member.remarks: When the value is greater than zero then a spline is approximated by straight line segments. If it's smaller than zero then it's approximated by arcs.
Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing code page string (variable $DWGCODEPAGE).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing code page (variable $DWGCODEPAGE). The default value is .

member.summary: Gets or sets whether objects have a handle or not (variable $HANDLING).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.HandleSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the handle seed used for DXF entities and blocks (variable $HANDSEED).
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions, but from (AC1012) onward, handles are no longer optional.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.ShowModelSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show model space (as opposed to paper space) (variable $TILEMODE). The default value is .

remarks.para: When showing model space, entities in paper space are invisible.
When showing paper space, entities in model space are first transformed to paper space as specified by a view port. Entities in paper space are not transformed.
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.FillMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to to fill wide polylines etc. when its z-axis is either (0, 0, 1) or (0, 0, -1). Also applies to hatches () and solids (). The default value is true. This value represents system variable FILLMODE.
member.remarks: Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.PaperSpaceLineTypeScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper space line type scaling. The default value is Normal. This value represents system variable PSLTSCALE.
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.PaperSpaceLimitsChecking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether limits are checked in paper space (variable $PLIMCHECK).
member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.DisplayLineWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display line weight for model space (variable $LWDISPLAY).

remarks.para: Default value is .
Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.DimensionStyleOverrides
member.summary: Gets the dimension style overrides.

remarks.para: The overrides override properties of .
Please note that not all dimension style properties are available in all versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current dimension style (variable $DIMSTYLE).

The dimension style is shared and must be present in .
Please note that not all dimension style properties are available in all versions.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to update dimensions while dragging. The default value is true. This value represents system variable DIMSHO.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.PointDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the point display mode. The default value is . This value represents system variable PDMODE.

remarks.para: This property does not affect points on the DEFPOINTS layer. This layer contains points that are part of objects like dimensions.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.PointDisplaySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the point display size. The default value is 0. This value represents system variable PDSIZE.

remarks.para: The default value (0) specifies a point size 5% of the screen size. A value greater than 0 specifies the absolute size, and a value less than 0 specifies a percentage size.
CadLib only supports rendering the absolute sizes, for values equal or less than 0, a point is drawn.
This property does not affect points on the DEFPOINTS layer. This layer contains points that are part of objects like dimensions.
Available in all supported versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.PolylineLineTypeGeneration

member.remarks: Introduced in , not available in earlier versions.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfHeader.AnnotationsAlwaysVisible
member.summary: A value indicating whether the annotative objects are always visible. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When this variable is false, annotative texts, etc., will be visible only if they support the current annotation scale. When it is on (the default), annotative objects behave as if the current annotation scale is the default scale for these objects. (ANNOALLVISIBLE dictionary variable)

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfVertex2D.Bulge
member.summary: Gets or sets the bulge (optional; default is 0) for curve segment. A negative value indicates a clockwise arc, a positive value indicates a counter clockwise arc.

remarks.para: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the endpoint. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.
See also helper methods and to get bulge values from arc center and end points or from the arc's included angle.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfPolyline2DSpline
member.summary: A spline curve subtype of the 2D poly line (POLYLINE) entity, built from objects.

remarks.para: The spline can be of degree 2 (quadratic) or 3 (cubic), see property SplineType.
The spline is defined by the and its degree (SplineType).
The are derived from the control points and are required for rendering by programs that itself don't calculate the spline curve from the control points (see method ).
The object coordinate system that affects all and is defined by properties and .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockPurgePreventer.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor
member.summary: Entity visitor which is bringing together all visited entities in a single method.

remarks.para: For nearly all visited entities the method is called.
For all classes extending the method is called, which just calls .
For all entities extending the method is called, which just calls .
For all entities extending the method is called, which just calls .
For all entities which insert a block into the model the method is called, which just calls for the inserting entity.
For all entities extending the method is called, which calls (see above).

For all entities extending the method is called, which does nothing at all because scenarios where vertexes are interesting are very rare. Furthermore to visit any vertex entities it would be necessary to override the various methods visiting entities extending and iterate over the vertexes of the visited entities.
The method makes it easy to visit a collection of entities, eg from or from .

Without overriding methods this class is completely useless, as you can also iterate directly over an entity collection. Usage szenarios are eg extracting all entities which are on a given layer, which only requires small adaptions, as this basic implementation does not step into blocks.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitEntity(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity)
member.summary: Visits an entity.
member.remarks: Do whatever you want with

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitDimension(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfDimension)
member.summary: Visits an dimension based entity.
member.remarks:
This allows to handle dimensions in a similar way. This basic implementation just calls
with the dimension and its block.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitModelerGeometry(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfModelerGeometry)
member.summary: Visits a modeler geometry based entity.
member.remarks: This allows to handle ACIS based entities in a similar way. This basic implementation just calls .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitInsertBase(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfInsertBase)
member.summary: Visits an insert based entity.
member.remarks: This allows to handle all entities inserting user-defined blocks in a similar way. This basic implemetation just calls with the entity and its block, and it calls with the collection.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitInsertingEntity(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity,WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfBlock)
member.summary: Visits an entity which inserts a block.
member.remarks: In this implementation this is called for entities inserting user-defined blocks (via ) and entities inserting automatically generated blocks (directly). This base implementation ignores the parameter and just calls for the .

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitVertex(WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfVertex)
member.summary: Visits a vertex base entity.

remarks.para: Vertexes are no stand-alone entities, the are parts of based entities. So handling them does not make sense in most scenarios. Therefore this base implementation does nothing at all.

Furthermore in this standard implementation this method will never be called because the Visit() methods for entities extending will not forward this visitor to their vertexes. So if you want to make use of this method you'll have to override all these methods.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.ConsolidatingEntityVisitor.VisitEntities(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfEntity})
member.summary: Visits all entities in the given collection.
member.remarks: This just applies the visitor pattern to all entities using this class as the visitor.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.IO.Dwg.Dwg2007.Compressor
member.summary: DWG 2007 uses a variation on the LZ77 compression algorithm.
member.remarks: Hashing is used to speed up for data lookups, so no sliding window is used. Note that because of this optimization not necessarily the longest match is found (favors speed over compression).

member.summary: Creates drawables for given DXF model using specified layout (see property ).

remarks.para: The old drawables are cleared before creating the new ones.

The entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the view ports in specified layout. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.

remarks.para: Entities in model space are transformed to paper space according to the given view ports. Entities that are already in paper space are not affected. Note that the first view port in represents paper space itself and should not be displayed.

member.param: The layout containing the paper space entities.
The view ports that describe the transformations to paper space. Use to get all the viewports of a layout. If this parameter is null, then all viewports of the specified layout are used.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfLayer
member.summary: Layer "containing" objects.

remarks.para: An entity is assigned to a layer by setting its Layer property. The layer must be part of the collection.
A layer can be enabled or disabled (see property ). When disabled the entities in that layer are not shown.

Similarly to this a layer can be frozen or thawed (see property ). Its function is almost identical to enabling/disabling, see a more elaborate AutoCAD manual for the differences (or e.g. ). Further more a layer can be frozen in a viewport by adding the layer to .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfLayer.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer name.

remarks.para: The name must be set to a value unequal to null.

For and earlier the name may not contain any spaces and may not be longer than 31 characters. Each character of the name should be a letter, digit or one of the following letters: $-_*. This constraint is checked when writing the dxf file by method .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfLayer.Frozen
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layer is frozen.

remarks.para: If a layer is frozen, then entities in this layer are not displayed. A layer can also be frozen in the context of a viewport. In this case a frozen layer is not shown in that viewport (add the layer to to achieve this).
Similarly to this a layer can be enabled or disabled (see property ). Its function is almost identical to freezing/thawing, see a more elaborate AutoCAD manual for the differences (or e.g. ).

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfLayer.Enabled
member.summary: Is layer enabled?

remarks.para: When the layer is not enabled, then entities in this layer are not displayed. If the layer is enabled, entities in this layer are displayed unless the layer is also frozen.

Similarly to this a layer can be frozen or thawed (see property ). Its function is almost identical to enabling/disabling, see a more elaborate AutoCAD manual for the differences (or e.g. ). Further more a layer can be frozen in a viewport by adding the layer to .

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel
member.summary: CAD model containing a CAD drawing ( objects, and tables).

remarks.para: A CAD model contains entities, which are either in model or paper space. When they are in model space, they are present in the model's collection. If they are in paper space, they are part of the DxfLayout.Entities of the (paper space) layout on which they are displayed.
Entities can be grouped in objects (see property DxfBlock.Entities), which can be referenced by zero or more entities.
Use / for reading into a CAD model object.
Use / for writing a CAD model object.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel.#ctor(WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel)
member.summary: Deep copy constructor.

remarks.para: This copies the .

Depending on the purpose of the copy it is possible that there are some differences necessary, which have to be set explicitly on the newly created model. In the header there are two GUIDs that may want to get new values: holds a unique id for a file, and holds a unique id for the file's version. Depending on the enviroment also some of the times and time spans in the header may want fixing, although most environments just ignore them: , , , , , and .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel.FallbackShxFont
member.summary: Get/set the fallback SHX font to be used when a font referenced in the file is not available.

remarks.para: A font defined here should be available in the directory of the DXF/DWG file, the directory of the executable or somewhere in the global SHX lookup directories, compare .
If this is set to null there is no fallback SHX font.
Font lookup is done in the following order:

list.item: A SHX font with the given name is searched in the SHX lookup directories.
If no SHX font is found, a TTF font which resolves to the given name is loaded.
If no TTF is found, the fallback SHX font is searched in the SHX lookup directories. This step is skipped if the fallback SHX font is null.
If step 3 has no results, the fallback TTF is loaded. This step is skipped if the fallback TTF is null.
If that also fails Arial TTF is used.
If even that fails, the system fallback font is used.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfModel.FallbackTrueTypeFont
member.summary: Get/set the fallback True Type font to be used when a font referenced in the file is not available.

remarks.para: If this is set to null there is no fallback True Type font.
Font lookup is done in the following order:

list.item: A SHX font with the given name is searched in the SHX lookup directories.
If no SHX font is found, a TTF font which resolves to the given name is loaded.
If no TTF is found, the fallback SHX font is searched in the SHX lookup directories. This step is skipped if the fallback SHX font is null.
If step 3 has no results, the fallback TTF is loaded. This step is skipped if the fallback TTF is null.
If that also fails Arial TTF is used.
If even that fails, the system fallback font is used.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Color
member.summary: Represents a color. A color has a color type and optional color value (index, RGB). The difference with class is that this class has an optional color book name and name. See also for a number of standard colors.
member.remarks:
Use one of the following to get a color:
, or .
Create an ACI color from a color index value. ACI stands for AutoCAD Color Index. See method . A number of often used ACI colors can be found in class .
Create an RGB color using method or one of its overloads. Optionally a color book name and name can be specified.

member.summary: Represents the dynamic block grip expression.

member.summary: Accepts the specified visitor.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DynamicBlock.DxfBlockGripExpression.Clone(WW.Cad.Model.CloneContext)
member.summary: Clones this object in the context of given model context.
member.remarks: The original and cloned object are stored in the clone context. The second time the Clone method is called, the clone from the first call is found in the clone context and returned. So for each new clone a new CloneContext instance has to be used.
member.exception: Thrown when reference to e.g. a line type is missing. (only when the clone context's reference resolution type is .)

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Objects.DxfSortEntsTable
member.summary: Represents an object that determines the entity drawing order for a block.

remarks.para: When drawing according to a , entities are sorted by their handle. In case a sort handle is defined for an entity, then that sort handle is used for sorting, otherwise the entity's own handle is used for sorting.
The SortEntsTable is stored in a block's extension dictionary, at entry named .
The SortEnts object was introduced in release 14.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMLine
member.summary: The MLine entity represents multiple parallel lines.

remarks.para: The MLine entity represents multiple line (see class ). Each line segment can contain one or more parallel elements (see ).
An MLine references an object defining the number, spacing, and appearance of the parallel lines.
Set the to when creating an mline.
This entity was introduced in release 13.
Unlike most entities, the z-axis does not affect the rendering of the MLine.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMLine.Segment.Element.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the element parameters.
member.remarks: The list may contain zero or more items. The first value is the distance from the segment vertex along the miter line to the point where the line element's path intersects the miter line. The next value is the distance along the line element's path from the point defined by the first value to the actual start of the line element. The next is the distance from the start of the line element to the first break (or cut) in the line element. The successive values continue to list the start and stop points of the line element in this segment of the mline. Linetypes do not affect these value.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfMLine.Segment.Element.AreaFillParameters
member.summary: Gets the area fill parameters.
member.remarks:
Similar to , it describes the parameterization of the fill area for this mline segment. The values are interpreted identically to the
and when taken as a whole for all line elements in the mline segment, they define the boundary of the fill area for the mline segment.

member.summary: Get the multiple transformations defined by this insertion. This returns the transformations used for the block, with the row as the first and the column as the second index. For the attributes associated with this insert use .

remarks.para: This takes care of possible multiple insertions (see ).
Please keep in mind that a block may define a translation by itself, which has to be used for the complete transformation which is applied to each entity in the block.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfInsert.AttributeInsertionTransformations
member.summary: Get the insertion transformations to be applied to the attributes associated with this insertion.
member.remarks: If this is not a multiple insertion, you can use the Attributes just as they are. Otherwise you'll have to use the transformations provided by this property in order to insert them correctly multiple times.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Entities.DxfPolygonSplineMesh
member.summary: Represents a polygon spline mesh (bezier, 2nd or 3rd degree spline surface).

remarks.para: The spline can be of degree 2 (quadratic) or 3 (cubic), see property SplineType.
The spline is defined by its and its degree (SplineType).
The are derived from the control points and are required for rendering by programs that itself don't calculate the spline curve from the control points (see method ).
The polygon mesh is optionally closed in m and/or n direction. See properties and .

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.ViewUtil
member.summary: Helper methods for handling views.
member.remarks: The methods of this class work on , and all relevant view-related classes provide a property which returns a proxy fulfilling this interface: , , .

members.member: Default focal length for camera: 50 mm.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ViewUtil.GetTransform(WW.Cad.Model.IViewDescription,WW.Math.Geometry.Rectangle2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the transformation which maps a view into a given rectangle.

remarks.para: Although a view might define clipping around its boundary and possibly also front and back clipping, the returned transformation does not care for that. Front and back clipping are rarely used, and the clipping around the boundary can be substituted by defining a 2D clipping region in your drawing subsystem (most 2D drawing routines allow setting a clip region). Just take care that the has the correct aspect ratio and use it also as the clipping region.

member.param: The view for which the display transformation is requested. Various view-related classes provide a ViewDescription property which can be used as a parameter for this method.
Target rectangle. If it does not have the aspect ratio of the view, the view is centered.
Invert the Y direction? This is necessary for screen display.
member.returns: Transformation matrix which maps the viewport centered into the given rectangle. The matrix will not be invertable for perspective views.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ViewUtil.GetTransform(WW.Cad.Model.IViewDescription,WW.Math.Size2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the transformation which maps a view into a rectangle of a given size.

remarks.para: Although a view might define clipping around its boundary and possibly also front and back clipping, the returned transformation does not care for that. Front and back clipping are rarely used, and the clipping around the boundary can be substituted by defining a 2D clipping region in your drawing subsystem (most 2D drawing routines allow setting a clip region). Just take care that the has the correct aspect ratio and use it also as the clipping region.

member.param: The view for which the display transformation is requested. Various view-related classes provide a ViewDescription property which can be used as a parameter for this method.
Size of target rectangle. If it does not have the aspect ratio of the view, the view is centered.
Invert the Y direction? This is necessary for screen display.
member.returns: Transformation matrix which maps the viewport centered into the given rectangle. The matrix will not be invertable for perspective views.

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.ViewUtil.GetTransform(WW.Cad.Model.IViewDescription,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the transformation which maps a view into a rectangle of a given size.

remarks.para: Although a view might define clipping around its boundary and possibly also front and back clipping, the returned transformation does not care for that. Front and back clipping are rarely used, and the clipping around the boundary can be substituted by defining a 2D clipping region in your drawing subsystem (most 2D drawing routines allow setting a clip region). Just take care that the has the correct aspect ratio and use it also as the clipping region.

member.param: The view for which the display transformation is requested. Various view-related classes provide a ViewDescription property which can be used as a parameter for this method.
Size of target rectangle. If it does not have the aspect ratio of the view, the view is centered.
Invert the Y direction? This is necessary for screen display.
member.returns: Transformation matrix which maps the viewport centered into the given rectangle. The matrix will not be invertable for perspective views.

SAT base class for Law definitions.
The sample string for the law definition: Law : "TRANS((TRANS(VEC(X,X2,X3),TRANS1))O(CUR(EDGE2)),TRANS3)" Three LawData elements are stored after law string: TRANS1 - data for transform EDGE2 - data for edge TRANS3 - data for transform

member.summary: Gets or sets the paper space to PDF scale factor (used to determine the line width based on each entity's line weight). The default value is 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets the layout. When null the model layout is exported to PDF.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfPageConfiguration.Viewports
member.summary: Gets or sets the viewports. When null all the viewports of the paper space are exported if the layout is set.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfPageConfiguration.PaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the paper. (see also and to get a paper size from a paper kind.) The default value is the letter format.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.IO.PdfPageConfiguration.ClipRectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets the clip rectangle. The units are the same as for , in hundredths of an inch. The default value is null.
member.remarks: Note that the PDF x-axis points right and the y-axis points up, and the origin is at the bottom left. The first corner of the rectangle should be the bottom left.

member.name: T:WW.Cad.Model.Tables.DxfLineType
member.summary: Represents a line type that can be applied to a entity (property ).

remarks.para: A line type must have a .
The appearance of the line type is defined by the property. Each element has a Length property. A negative value represents a space, zero represents a dot, a positive value represents a line segment.
There are a few predefined line types: , and .

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfValueFormat.DecimalNumber.Precision
member.summary: Gets or sets the precision.

remarks.para: For decimal, engineering and scientific units the precision indicates the number of decimals.

For architectural units the precision corresponds to the precision in inches:
value precision in feet/inches
0 0'0"
1 0'0 1/2"
1 0'0 1/4"
1 0'0 1/8"
1 0'0 1/16"
1 0'0 1/32"
1 0'0 1/64"
1 0'0 1/128"
1 0'0 1/256"

For fractional units the precision corresponds to the denominator:
value denominator
0 0
1 0 1/2
1 0 1/4
1 0 1/8
1 0 1/16
1 0 1/32
1 0 1/64
1 0 1/128
1 0 1/256

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.DxfValueFormat.Date.CreateRegionalLongDate
member.summary: Creates a regional long date value format (e.g. Saturday, March 29, 2008).

member.summary: Creates a regional long date time value format (e.g. Saturday, March 29, 2008 7:51:24 PM).

member.summary: Creates a regional short date value format (e.g. 3/29/2008).

member.name: M:WW.Cad.Model.DxfValueFormat.Date.CreateRegionalTime
member.summary: Creates a regional time value format.

member.name: P:WW.Cad.Model.DxfValueFormat.Date.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string (the default value is null).
member.remarks:
The following sub strings can be used in the date format string.
Sub string Explanation
M month number
d day number
dd day number
yy year number (2 digits)
yyyy year number (4 digits)
dddd day spelled out
MMMM month spelled out
MMM 3 letter abbreviation of month
h hours (0-11)
HH hours (0-23)
mm minutes
ss seconds
tt AM/PM
%#x regional long date: e.g. Saturday, March 29, 2008
%#c regional long date time: e.g. Saturday, March 29, 2008 7:51:24 PM
%x regional short date: e.g. 3/29/2008
%c regional short date time: e.g. 3/29/2008 7:51:24 PM
%X regional time
